files.content:
# INVEST IN CONGO â€” Investment Platform Brief
## Company #3 of 4 | DRC Investment Opportunity Platform

**Date:** February 15, 2026  
**Company:** Invest in Congo / Investir en RD Congo  
**Location:** `Z:\Digital Office\2025\Investir en RD congo\investirenrdcongo-web\`

---

## ðŸŽ¯ Overview

Bilingual (English/French) investment platform connecting **international and local investors** with vetted opportunities across the Democratic Republic of Congo. Covers 10 sectors: mining, energy, agriculture, infrastructure, real estate, technology, healthcare, education, tourism, manufacturing.

---

## ðŸ’¼ Business Model

**Freemium SaaS** with 4 membership tiers:

| Tier | Price | Access |
|------|-------|--------|
| **BASIC** | Free | Browse limited projects |
| **INVESTOR** | â‚¬99/mo | Full project details, submit EOI |
| **STRATEGIC** | â‚¬249/mo | + Portfolio tracking, downloads |
| **PARTNER** | â‚¬499/mo | + Full access, priority support |

**Annual billing:** ~17% discount  
**Revenue Streams:** Subscriptions + Potential project commissions

---

## ðŸ—ï¸ Tech Stack

| Layer | Technology |
|-------|-----------|
| Framework | Next.js 15 (App Router) |
| Language | TypeScript |
| UI | React 19 + Tailwind CSS + shadcn/ui |
| Database | PostgreSQL + Prisma ORM 7.x |
| Auth | NextAuth v5 (beta) |
| Payments | Stripe (subscriptions) |
| i18n | next-intl (EN/FR) |
| Email | Resend |
| Charts | Recharts |
| Deploy | Target: Vercel |

---

## ðŸŒ Global Office Registry

**DRC (4):** Kinshasa (HQ), Lubumbashi, Goma, Kolwezi  
**Europe (3):** Paris/Torcy, Brussels, London  
**Americas (1):** New York  
**Africa (1):** Johannesburg

---

## ðŸ“‹ Key Features

### Public-Facing
- Investment project showcase (bilingual)
- News/intelligence feed (9+ sources)
- Dynamic contact page
- Pricing tiers

### Member Portal
- User dashboard
- EOI (Expression of Interest) submission
- Portfolio tracking (Strategic+)
- Investment performance tracking
- Document downloads (tier-gated)

### Admin Panel
- Project management (CRUD, EOI review)
- Office management
- Intelligence feed management
- Analytics dashboard (metrics, charts, export)
- Newsletter campaigns

---

## ðŸš€ Status: Pre-Launch

**Phase Required:**
1. **Launch Prep** â€” Stripe setup, OAuth, Resend, R2, Vercel deploy
2. **Content** â€” Live intelligence feeds, real projects, office contacts
3. **Operations** â€” Legal review, marketing, onboarding first investors

**Seeded Data:** 6 sample projects, 5 test users, 9 global offices

---

## ðŸŽ¯ Next Actions Required

- [ ] Set up Stripe products/prices
- [ ] Configure Google OAuth credentials
- [ ] Set up Resend with verified domain
- [ ] Deploy to Vercel
- [ ] Set up production PostgreSQL database
- [ ] Test intelligence feed CRON
- [ ] Onboard first real projects

---

## Related Companies

| # | Company | Focus |
|---|---------|-------|
| 1 | **Pulse Graphix** | Creative design agency |
| 2 | **Nexus AI Academy** | AI-powered LMS |
| 3 | **Invest in Congo** | DRC investment platform |
| 4 | *[TBD]* | *[Awaiting brief]* |

files.name: content-strategy.md
files.content:
# Invest in DRC â€” Content & Newsletter Strategy

**Purpose:** Transform Invest in DRC into THE global hub for DRC investment intelligence  
**Date:** March 2026  
**Prepared For:** Kabundji

---

## 1. CONTENT STRATEGY

### 1.1 Content Pillars

| Pillar | Description | Frequency | Example |
|--------|-------------|-----------|---------|
| **Market Intelligence** | Mining data, commodity prices, economic indicators | Daily/Weekly | "Cobalt prices surge 15% â€” what it means for DRC" |
| **Deal Flow** | New projects, partnerships, JVs, government tenders | As they happen | "Kamoa-Kakula Phase 3 expansion announced" |
| **Policy & Regulation** | Mining code changes, tax policy, bilateral deals | As they happen | "New DRC mining code amendments: investor impact analysis" |
| **Sector Deep Dives** | In-depth analysis of mining, energy, agriculture, etc. | Monthly | "DRC Lithium: The Manono opportunity explained" |
| **Investor Guides** | How-to content for entering DRC market | Evergreen | "Step-by-step: Setting up a mining company in DRC" |
| **Success Stories** | Case studies of successful DRC investments | Monthly | "How Ivanhoe built Africa's largest copper mine" |
| **Data & Reports** | Original research, infographics, statistics | Quarterly | "Q1 2026 DRC Investment Report" |

### 1.2 Target Audiences

| Audience | What They Want | Content Strategy |
|----------|---------------|------------------|
| **Institutional Investors** | Risk-adjusted returns, due diligence data, market sizing | Deep analytical reports, risk assessments, quarterly data |
| **Mining Companies** | Exploration data, licensing process, geological info | Sector deep dives, regulatory guides, deal alerts |
| **Private Equity / VC** | Deal flow, growth sectors, exit opportunities | Deal alerts, sector analysis, success stories |
| **DRC Diaspora** | Homeland investment, real estate, agriculture | Accessible guides, diaspora-specific opportunities |
| **Development Organizations** | Impact data, ESG metrics, governance progress | EITI reports, governance analysis, impact stories |
| **Government / Embassies** | Trade promotion, bilateral relations | Policy briefs, economic data, event coverage |

### 1.3 Voice & Tone

- **Authority:** Write like the Financial Times or The Economist on Africa â€” confident, data-backed, insightful
- **Bilingual:** Every piece in both EN and FR (FR especially important for Francophone Africa, Belgium, France)
- **Professional but accessible:** No jargon without explanation; an investor with no DRC knowledge should understand
- **Balanced:** Acknowledge risks honestly (governance, security) while highlighting opportunities â€” credibility > hype
- **Data-first:** Lead with numbers, charts, and evidence

### 1.4 Weekly Content Calendar

| Day | Content Type | Channel |
|-----|-------------|---------|
| **Monday** | Weekly Market Brief (prices, exchange rates, key data) | Platform + Newsletter |
| **Tuesday** | Sector Spotlight article | Platform blog |
| **Wednesday** | News roundup (curated from sources) | Platform feed |
| **Thursday** | Investor Guide or How-To | Platform blog |
| **Friday** | Weekly Newsletter Digest sent | Email (Resend) |
| **Ad hoc** | Flash Alerts for breaking news/deals | Email + Platform |

---

## 2. NEWSLETTER SYSTEM

### 2.1 Newsletter Types

#### A. Weekly Digest â€” "DRC Investment Pulse"
**Frequency:** Every Friday  
**Audience:** All subscribers  
**Structure:**

```
SUBJECT: DRC Investment Pulse â€” [Key headline] | Week of [date]

1. ðŸ”¥ TOP STORY (200 words)
   - The biggest DRC investment news this week
   - Link to full article on platform

2. ðŸ“Š MARKET SNAPSHOT
   - Cobalt price: $XX,XXX/ton (â†‘/â†“ X%)
   - Copper price: $X,XXX/ton (â†‘/â†“ X%)
   - USD/CDF exchange rate
   - Key economic indicator of the week

3. ðŸ“° THIS WEEK IN DRC (5 curated headlines)
   - Headline 1 â†’ [link]
   - Headline 2 â†’ [link]
   - Headline 3 â†’ [link]
   - Headline 4 â†’ [link]
   - Headline 5 â†’ [link]

4. ðŸŽ¯ OPPORTUNITY SPOTLIGHT
   - Featured investment project from the platform
   - Quick facts: sector, size, stage, returns
   - CTA: "View full details â†’"

5. ðŸ“… UPCOMING EVENTS
   - Conferences, government meetings, deadlines

6. ðŸ’¡ INSIGHT OF THE WEEK
   - One analytical paragraph (thought leadership)

FOOTER: Subscribe tiers CTA | Share | Unsubscribe
```

#### B. Monthly Deep Dive â€” "DRC Investment Report"
**Frequency:** 1st of each month  
**Audience:** Investor+ subscribers (gated for free tier)  
**Structure:**

```
SUBJECT: DRC Investment Report â€” [Month] 2026: [Theme]

1. EXECUTIVE SUMMARY (300 words)
2. SECTOR ANALYSIS (1 sector per month, rotating)
3. DEAL TRACKER (new projects, completed deals)
4. POLICY UPDATE (regulation changes)
5. ECONOMIC INDICATORS DASHBOARD
6. RISK ASSESSMENT UPDATE
7. FEATURED PROJECTS (3-5 from platform)
8. EXPERT COMMENTARY
```

#### C. Flash Alerts â€” "DRC FLASH"
**Frequency:** As needed (max 2/week)  
**Audience:** All subscribers  
**Triggers:** Major deal announcement, policy change, bilateral agreement, market disruption

```
SUBJECT: âš¡ DRC FLASH: [Breaking headline]

[3-5 paragraphs: What happened, why it matters, what to do]
[Link to full analysis on platform]
```

### 2.2 Subject Line Formulas

- `DRC Investment Pulse â€” [Compelling headline] | Week of [date]`
- `âš¡ DRC FLASH: [Breaking news in 8 words or less]`
- `[Mineral] prices [up/down] X% â€” DRC impact analysis`
- `New [sector] opportunity: [project name] seeking investors`
- `DRC [Month] Report: [X] deals worth $[Y]M tracked`
- `Why [major company] just invested $[X]M in DRC`
- `The [number] DRC sectors investors are watching in 2026`

### 2.3 Signup Strategy & Lead Magnets

| Lead Magnet | Format | Gate |
|-------------|--------|------|
| "DRC Investment Starter Kit" | PDF guide | Email signup |
| "Top 10 DRC Mining Opportunities 2026" | PDF report | Email signup |
| "DRC Risk Assessment Framework" | PDF checklist | Email signup |
| Weekly newsletter | Email | Email signup |
| Monthly report | Email | Investor tier ($99/mo) |
| Full project database | Platform | Strategic tier ($249/mo) |

### 2.4 Email Automation Flows (Resend + Next.js)

#### Welcome Series (5 emails over 14 days)
```
Day 0:  Welcome + DRC Investment Starter Kit PDF
Day 2:  "Why DRC? The opportunity in numbers" (data-heavy)
Day 5:  "How our platform works" + featured projects
Day 9:  Success story / case study
Day 14: "Ready to go deeper?" â†’ upgrade CTA to Investor tier
```

#### Nurture Sequence (monthly for free tier)
```
Month 1: Sector spotlight â€” Mining
Month 2: Sector spotlight â€” Energy
Month 3: Sector spotlight â€” Agriculture
Month 4: "Quarterly results" + upgrade CTA
(repeat with new sectors)
```

#### Tech Implementation
```
Resend API â†’ Next.js API routes:
- POST /api/newsletter/subscribe â†’ add to Resend audience
- POST /api/newsletter/send â†’ trigger campaign
- CRON /api/newsletter/weekly â†’ auto-assemble Friday digest
- Webhook /api/newsletter/events â†’ track opens/clicks
```

---

## 3. NEWS FLASH / INTELLIGENCE FEED

### 3.1 Feed Categories

| Category | Icon | Sources |
|----------|------|---------|
| **Mining** | â›ï¸ | Mining.com, Mining Weekly, S&P Global |
| **Policy** | ðŸ›ï¸ | Radio Okapi, ActualitÃ©.cd, government sites |
| **Deals** | ðŸ’° | Reuters, Bloomberg, Africa Intelligence |
| **Infrastructure** | ðŸ—ï¸ | AfDB, World Bank, Jeune Afrique |
| **Market Data** | ðŸ“Š | LME, World Bank API, BCC |
| **ESG & Governance** | ðŸŒ¿ | EITI, IPIS, Resource Matters |

### 3.2 Curation Workflow

```
AUTOMATED (n8n):
  RSS feeds â†’ Filter (DRC keywords) â†’ Deduplicate â†’ Draft queue

EDITORIAL (Manual, 30 min/day):
  Review draft queue â†’ Edit headlines â†’ Add commentary â†’ Tag category â†’ Publish

QUALITY RULES:
  - Every item must have: source attribution, date, category tag
  - Add 1-2 sentence editorial context ("Why this matters for investors")
  - Verify claims from at least 2 sources for major stories
  - No republishing full articles â€” summarize + link to source
```

### 3.3 n8n Workflow: RSS â†’ Platform

```
Trigger: Every 2 hours
1. HTTP Request â†’ Fetch RSS from 6+ sources
2. Filter â†’ Keywords: "DRC", "Congo", "cobalt", "Katanga", "mining", "Kinshasa"
3. Deduplicate â†’ Check against existing DB entries (URL hash)
4. Format â†’ Standardize: title, summary, source, date, category, image
5. POST â†’ Platform API: /api/intelligence/draft
6. Notify â†’ Slack/Telegram alert to editorial queue
```

---

## 4. INVESTOR ATTRACTION STRATEGY

### 4.1 SEO Strategy

**Primary Keywords (EN):**
- "invest in DRC" / "invest in Congo"
- "DRC mining opportunities"
- "Democratic Republic Congo investment"
- "cobalt investment DRC"
- "DRC business opportunities 2026"

**Primary Keywords (FR):**
- "investir en RDC"
- "opportunitÃ©s miniÃ¨res RDC"
- "investissement RÃ©publique DÃ©mocratique du Congo"

**SEO Content Plan:**
- 1 long-form article (2000+ words) per week targeting a primary keyword
- Each article: meta title, description, OG image, structured data
- Internal linking between articles and platform projects
- Build topical authority: become THE content resource for "DRC investment"

### 4.2 LinkedIn Strategy

**Profile:** "Invest in DRC" company page  
**Posting:** 3-5x/week

| Post Type | Frequency | Example |
|-----------|-----------|---------|
| Data graphic / chart | 2x/week | Infographic: "DRC Cobalt Production 2020-2026" |
| News commentary | 2x/week | "The US-DRC minerals deal changes everything. Here's why â†’" |
| Long-form article | 1x/week | Republish platform blog post |
| Event coverage | As needed | DRC Mining Week highlights |

**Engagement:** Comment on posts from Mining Indaba, World Bank, AfDB, mining companies â†’ build visibility

### 4.3 Partnership Strategy

| Partner Type | Action | Goal |
|-------------|--------|------|
| **Mining conferences** | Sponsor/exhibit at DRC Mining Week, Mining Indaba | Direct investor access |
| **DRC Embassies** | Offer platform as official investment resource | Credibility + referral traffic |
| **ANAPI** | Partnership as digital investment portal | Government backing |
| **Trade bodies** | FEC, AmCham co-branded content | Network access |
| **Think tanks** | Guest publish their DRC research | Content + credibility |
| **Law firms** | DRC investment legal guides on platform | Professional network |

### 4.4 Lead Generation Funnel

```
AWARENESS:
  LinkedIn posts â†’ SEO articles â†’ PR/media mentions
  â†“
INTEREST:
  Free newsletter signup â†’ Lead magnet download
  â†“
CONSIDERATION:
  Weekly digest â†’ Platform browsing â†’ Free project previews
  â†“
CONVERSION:
  Investor tier signup ($99/mo) â†’ Full project access
  â†“
EXPANSION:
  Strategic tier ($249/mo) â†’ Partner tier ($499/mo)
  â†“
ADVOCACY:
  Referral program â†’ Conference networking â†’ Word of mouth
```

### 4.5 Referral Program

- Existing subscribers refer new Investor+ signups
- Reward: 1 month free for every 3 referrals who subscribe
- Track via unique referral links
- Display on dashboard: "Your referrals: X"

---

## 5. CONTENT AUTOMATION SYSTEM

### 5.1 n8n Workflows to Build

| # | Workflow | Trigger | Input | Output |
|---|----------|---------|-------|--------|
| 1 | **DRC News Aggregator** | Every 2h | RSS feeds (6+ sources) | Draft news items in DB |
| 2 | **Economic Data Sync** | Monthly (1st) | World Bank API | Updated indicators dashboard |
| 3 | **Metal Price Tracker** | Daily 9am | Free metals API | Price widget data |
| 4 | **Newsletter Assembler** | Friday 8am | Week's published content | Draft newsletter in Resend |
| 5 | **Social Post Generator** | On article publish | New platform article | LinkedIn post draft |
| 6 | **Report Monitor** | Weekly | Think tank RSS | Alert for new DRC publications |

### 5.2 Editorial Quality Control

```
AUTOMATED content â†’ DRAFT status (never auto-publish)
  â†“
Human review (Kabundji or editor) â†’ 30 min/day
  â†“
Approved â†’ PUBLISHED
  â†“
Auto-included in Friday newsletter assembly
```

**Rule:** Automation handles collection and formatting. Humans handle editorial judgment and publishing.

---

## 6. LAUNCH CONTENT PLAN â€” FIRST 30 DAYS

### Pre-Launch (Days -7 to 0): Seed Content

Before going live, publish these foundation pieces:

| # | Article | Type | Purpose |
|---|---------|------|---------|
| 1 | "Why DRC? The $24 Trillion Opportunity" | Pillar article | SEO + credibility |
| 2 | "US-DRC Critical Minerals Deal: Full Analysis" | Deep dive | Timely authority |
| 3 | "DRC Mining Sector: Complete Investor Guide" | Evergreen guide | SEO foundation |
| 4 | "10 Key Facts About Investing in DRC" | Listicle | Shareable + SEO |
| 5 | "DRC Investment Risk: An Honest Assessment" | Analysis | Trust-building |
| 6 | "How to Set Up a Business in DRC: Step by Step" | How-to | Practical value |
| 7 | "DRC's Top 5 Mining Projects to Watch in 2026" | Curated | Deal flow showcase |
| 8 | "Cobalt, Copper, Lithium: DRC's Mineral Wealth Explained" | Educational | Awareness |

### Week 1: Soft Launch
- Publish platform with seed content
- Send announcement to existing contacts
- Post on LinkedIn (3 posts)
- First newsletter: "Welcome to Invest in DRC"

### Week 2: Content Rhythm
- Begin daily news feed updates
- Publish 2 new articles
- LinkedIn: 4 posts
- Newsletter #2: First weekly digest

### Week 3: Outreach
- Contact DRC embassies about partnership
- Reach out to 5 mining industry LinkedIn influencers
- Submit platform to relevant directories
- Newsletter #3 + first Flash Alert

### Week 4: Assessment & Scale
- Analyze: signups, traffic sources, newsletter open rates
- Adjust content based on what's performing
- Begin planning first Monthly Deep Dive report
- Newsletter #4

### KPIs for First 30 Days
- Newsletter subscribers: 500+
- Platform visitors: 2,000+
- LinkedIn followers: 200+
- Newsletter open rate: >30%
- At least 1 Investor tier conversion

---

## 7. MONETIZATION THROUGH CONTENT

### 7.1 Free vs Gated Content

| Content | Free (Basic) | Investor ($99) | Strategic ($249) | Partner ($499) |
|---------|-------------|----------------|-------------------|----------------|
| News feed | âœ… (headlines) | âœ… (full) | âœ… | âœ… |
| Weekly newsletter | âœ… | âœ… | âœ… | âœ… |
| Blog articles | âœ… | âœ… | âœ… | âœ… |
| Monthly report | âŒ Summary only | âœ… Full | âœ… | âœ… |
| Project details | âŒ Teaser | âœ… Full | âœ… | âœ… |
| Data downloads | âŒ | âŒ | âœ… | âœ… |
| Quarterly research | âŒ | âŒ | âœ… | âœ… |
| Priority deal alerts | âŒ | âŒ | âŒ | âœ… |
| Direct introductions | âŒ | âŒ | âŒ | âœ… |

### 7.2 Premium Content Products

| Product | Price | Description |
|---------|-------|-------------|
| "DRC Mining Investment Report 2026" | Included in Strategic+ | 50-page annual analysis |
| Sector-specific white papers | Included in Strategic+ | Deep dive per sector |
| Custom research | â‚¬2,000+ | Bespoke research for institutions |
| Sponsored content | â‚¬500-2,000/post | Clearly labeled, editorial standards |
| Webinar series | â‚¬50/ticket or included in Strategic+ | Expert panels on DRC sectors |

### 7.3 Sponsored Content Guidelines
- Clearly marked as "Sponsored" or "Partner Content"
- Must be relevant to DRC investment
- Editorial team retains right to edit/refuse
- No misleading claims about investment returns
- Maximum 2 sponsored pieces per month (maintain trust)

---

## 8. IMPLEMENTATION PRIORITY

### Phase 1: Foundation (Weeks 1-2)
- [ ] Set up Resend audiences (Free, Investor, Strategic, Partner)
- [ ] Build newsletter templates in Resend
- [ ] Create 8 seed articles
- [ ] Set up n8n RSS aggregation workflow
- [ ] Create LinkedIn company page

### Phase 2: Launch (Weeks 3-4)
- [ ] Soft launch platform with seed content
- [ ] Send first newsletter
- [ ] Begin daily news feed
- [ ] Activate n8n workflows
- [ ] Start LinkedIn posting

### Phase 3: Growth (Month 2-3)
- [ ] First Monthly Deep Dive report
- [ ] Embassy/ANAPI outreach
- [ ] Referral program launch
- [ ] SEO optimization based on analytics
- [ ] First Flash Alert

### Phase 4: Scale (Month 4-6)
- [ ] First paid subscriber milestone (50 Investor tier)
- [ ] Sponsored content program
- [ ] Webinar series launch
- [ ] Conference presence (DRC Mining Week)
- [ ] Quarterly research publication

---

*This strategy positions Invest in DRC as the Bloomberg Terminal of DRC investment â€” the platform serious investors can't afford to ignore.*

*Document by Alex Prime for Kabundji â€” March 2026*

files.name: drc-investment-sources.md
files.content:
# DRC Investment Information Sources â€” Comprehensive Directory

**Purpose:** Authoritative sources for the "Invest in DRC" website  
**Last Updated:** March 2026  
**Prepared For:** Kabundji / Invest in Congo

---

## Table of Contents

1. [Official Government Sources](#1-official-government-sources)
2. [Mining & Minerals Authorities](#2-mining--minerals-authorities)
3. [International Organizations](#3-international-organizations)
4. [Think Tanks & Research Institutes](#4-think-tanks--research-institutes)
5. [Industry & Trade Bodies](#5-industry--trade-bodies)
6. [Private Intelligence & Consulting](#6-private-intelligence--consulting)
7. [News & Media Sources](#7-news--media-sources)
8. [Data Providers & Integration](#8-data-providers--integration)
9. [Website Integration Guide](#9-website-integration-guide)

---

## 1. OFFICIAL GOVERNMENT SOURCES

### 1.1 MinistÃ¨re des Mines (Ministry of Mines)
- **URL:** https://mines.gouv.cd/
- **Provides:** Mining legislation, geological maps, mining rights administration, regulatory updates
- **Why:** Primary government authority for all mining sector regulation in DRC
- **Contact:** Web contact form; webmail at https://webmail.mines.gouv.cd/
- **Integration:** No public API; monitor press releases manually

### 1.2 CAMI â€” Cadastre Minier (Mining Registry)
- **URL:** https://camigrandkatanga.org/
- **Provides:** Mining rights registration, permit applications, cadastral maps, title registry
- **Why:** Official repository of ALL mining rights and titles in DRC
- **Contact:** Physical access for most records; some online queries
- **Integration:** Limited digital; direct relationship recommended

### 1.3 ANAPI â€” Agence Nationale pour la Promotion des Investissements
- **URL:** https://www.anapi.cd/
- **Provides:** Investment facilitation, one-stop business registration, investment opportunities database, tax incentives info
- **Why:** Primary government agency for foreign direct investment promotion
- **Contact:** info@anapi.cd â€” Kinshasa headquarters
- **Integration:** Key partner for investor onboarding; link prominently

### 1.4 Banque Centrale du Congo (BCC)
- **URL:** https://www.bcc.cd/
- **Provides:** Exchange rates, monetary policy, banking supervision, economic statistics
- **Why:** Central bank â€” sole authority on monetary statistics and exchange rate policy
- **Contact:** info@bcc.cd â€” 563, Blvd. Colonel Tshiatshi, Gombe, Kinshasa
- **Integration:** No public API; rates need manual curation

### 1.5 MinistÃ¨re de l'Ã‰conomie Nationale
- **Provides:** Trade policy, economic development programs, business environment reforms
- **Why:** Sets overall economic policy framework for investment

### 1.6 DRC Embassy in USA
- **URL:** https://www.ambardcusa.org/
- **Provides:** Investment info for US investors, sector guides, consular services
- **Contact:** Washington DC office
- **Integration:** Useful for US investor outreach content

### 1.7 Presidency / Primature
- **URL:** https://www.presidence.cd/
- **Provides:** Presidential decrees, high-level policy announcements, bilateral agreements
- **Why:** Source for major policy shifts affecting investment climate

---

## 2. MINING & MINERALS AUTHORITIES

### 2.1 US-DRC Critical Minerals Agreement (2025)
- **URL:** https://www.state.gov/ (search: DRC critical minerals partnership)
- **Provides:** Official bilateral agreement text, framework for US investment in DRC mining, critical minerals supply chain coordination
- **Why:** Highest-level bilateral commitment â€” THE landmark deal driving current DRC investment interest
- **Contact:** US State Department Bureau of African Affairs
- **Integration:** Embed official agreement link prominently; major credibility marker

### 2.2 USGS â€” U.S. Geological Survey
- **URL:** https://www.usgs.gov/centers/national-minerals-information-center
- **Provides:** Mineral commodity summaries, DRC-specific mineral statistics, cobalt/copper/lithium/coltan production data
- **Why:** Global gold standard for mineral statistics; scientifically rigorous, public domain data
- **Contact:** Public data
- **Integration:** **API available** at https://minerals.usgs.gov/ â€” ideal for embedding mineral data widgets

### 2.3 British Geological Survey (BGS)
- **URL:** https://www.bgs.ac.uk/
- **Provides:** World Mineral Production reports, critical minerals lists, geological assessments
- **Why:** Respected independent geological authority with DRC coverage
- **Integration:** Annual reports downloadable; some data APIs

### 2.4 Cobalt Institute
- **URL:** https://www.cobaltinstitute.org/
- **Provides:** Cobalt market data, responsible sourcing standards, supply chain insights
- **Why:** THE authority on cobalt â€” DRC produces ~70% of world cobalt
- **Integration:** Market reports, responsible sourcing content

### 2.5 London Metal Exchange (LME)
- **URL:** https://www.lme.com/
- **Provides:** Real-time and historical prices for cobalt, copper, and other metals
- **Why:** Global benchmark pricing authority
- **Integration:** **API available** (paid) for real-time price widgets

### 2.6 DRC Mining Week / VUKA Group
- **URL:** https://wearevuka.com/mining/drc-mining-week/
- **Provides:** Annual mining conference and expo, industry networking
- **Why:** Premier industry event for DRC mining sector
- **Contact:** +27 21 700 3500 â€” held annually in Lubumbashi
- **Integration:** Event calendar integration; sponsorship opportunities

### 2.7 Major Mining Companies Operating in DRC

| Company | Focus | URL |
|---------|-------|-----|
| **Glencore (Katanga Mining)** | Copper, cobalt | https://www.glencore.com/ |
| **CMOC Group (China Moly)** | Tenke Fungurume (copper, cobalt) | https://www.cmoc.com/ |
| **Barrick Gold** | Kibali Gold Mine | https://www.barrick.com/ |
| **Ivanhoe Mines** | Kamoa-Kakula (copper) | https://www.ivanhoemines.com/ |
| **ERG (Eurasian Resources)** | Copper, cobalt | https://www.erg.kz/ |
| **Sicomines** | Chinese consortium | â€” |
| **Gecamines** | State mining company | https://www.gecamines.cd/ |

---

## 3. INTERNATIONAL ORGANIZATIONS

### 3.1 World Bank â€” DRC
- **URL:** https://www.worldbank.org/en/country/drc/overview
- **Data Portal:** https://data.worldbank.org/country/CD
- **Provides:** Development projects, economic indicators, investment climate assessments, sector reports
- **Why:** Premier multilateral institution; rigorous data standards
- **Integration:** **FREE API** at `http://api.worldbank.org/v2/country/CD` â€” JSON format, no key required âœ…

### 3.2 IMF â€” International Monetary Fund
- **URL:** https://www.imf.org/en/Countries/COD
- **Provides:** Article IV reports, debt sustainability analyses, economic outlook, policy recommendations
- **Why:** Primary international authority on DRC macroeconomic stability
- **Integration:** RSS feed for press releases; PDF reports linkable

### 3.3 African Development Bank (AfDB)
- **URL:** https://www.afdb.org/en/countries/central-africa/democratic-republic-of-congo
- **Provides:** Country strategy papers, infrastructure projects, economic sector work
- **Why:** Regional development bank with deep DRC expertise
- **Integration:** XML data feeds for registered users

### 3.4 EITI â€” Extractive Industries Transparency Initiative
- **URL:** https://eiti.org/countries/democratic-republic-of-congo
- **Provides:** Revenue transparency reports, mining sector governance data, payment disclosures
- **Why:** Global standard for transparency in extractive industries; DRC is a member
- **Integration:** **Open data** â€” downloadable datasets, embeddable charts

### 3.5 UNCTAD â€” UN Conference on Trade and Development
- **URL:** https://unctad.org/
- **Provides:** FDI statistics, investment policy reviews, bilateral investment treaties
- **Why:** UN authority on investment flows to developing countries
- **Integration:** Investment data API available

### 3.6 IFC â€” International Finance Corporation
- **URL:** https://www.ifc.org/
- **Provides:** Private sector investment data, project finance, business environment assessments
- **Why:** World Bank Group's private sector arm; active in DRC
- **Integration:** Project database searchable

### 3.7 UNDP â€” UN Development Programme
- **URL:** https://www.cd.undp.org/
- **Provides:** Human development indicators, governance programs, sustainability data
- **Why:** Broad development context for investment decisions

---

## 4. THINK TANKS & RESEARCH INSTITUTES

### 4.1 Congo Research Group (CRG) â€” NYU
- **URL:** https://congoresearchgroup.org/
- **Provides:** Deep analytical reports on DRC politics, conflict, governance, economy
- **Why:** THE leading academic research group focused exclusively on DRC
- **Integration:** RSS feed; reports embeddable

### 4.2 IPIS â€” International Peace Information Service
- **URL:** https://ipisresearch.be/
- **Provides:** Mining sector mapping, conflict minerals tracking, supply chain due diligence
- **Why:** Premier research on artisanal mining and conflict minerals in DRC
- **Integration:** **Interactive maps** embeddable â€” excellent visual content

### 4.3 Chatham House (Royal Institute of International Affairs)
- **URL:** https://www.chathamhouse.org/ (search DRC/Congo)
- **Provides:** Policy papers on DRC governance, resources, geopolitics
- **Why:** World's leading foreign affairs think tank; frequent DRC coverage

### 4.4 Atlantic Council â€” Africa Center
- **URL:** https://www.atlanticcouncil.org/programs/africa-center/
- **Provides:** US-Africa policy analysis, critical minerals strategy, DRC geopolitical analysis
- **Why:** Influential on US foreign policy; directly covers US-DRC minerals partnership

### 4.5 CSIS â€” Center for Strategic and International Studies
- **URL:** https://www.csis.org/ (search DRC/critical minerals)
- **Provides:** Strategic analysis of DRC minerals, China-US competition in Africa
- **Why:** Top US think tank; shapes policy conversation on DRC resources

### 4.6 Brookings Institution â€” Africa Growth Initiative
- **URL:** https://www.brookings.edu/topic/africa/
- **Provides:** Economic development analysis, governance research, investment climate studies
- **Why:** Premier policy research institution with Africa program

### 4.7 Resource Matters
- **URL:** https://www.resourcematters.org/
- **Provides:** DRC mining contract analysis, revenue transparency, governance research
- **Why:** Focused specifically on DRC extractive sector governance

### 4.8 Southern Africa Resource Watch (SARW)
- **URL:** https://www.sarwatch.org/
- **Provides:** Natural resource governance monitoring, community impact studies
- **Why:** Regional resource governance authority

### 4.9 Pole Institute (Goma)
- **URL:** https://www.pole-institute.org/
- **Provides:** Eastern DRC research, mining community studies, local economic analysis
- **Why:** On-the-ground DRC research institute; unique local perspective

---

## 5. INDUSTRY & TRADE BODIES

### 5.1 FEC â€” FÃ©dÃ©ration des Entreprises du Congo
- **URL:** https://www.fec-rdc.com/
- **Provides:** Business advocacy, member directory, investment forums, sector committees
- **Why:** THE private sector umbrella organization in DRC â€” equivalent to Chamber of Commerce
- **Contact:** Kinshasa headquarters
- **Integration:** Member directory for business partnerships

### 5.2 Chambre des Mines
- **Provides:** Mining industry association, policy advocacy, industry statistics
- **Why:** Voice of the mining industry in DRC; sector-specific advocacy

### 5.3 Mining Indaba
- **URL:** https://miningindaba.com/
- **Provides:** Africa's largest mining conference (Cape Town), investor matching, deal flow
- **Why:** Where DRC mining deals are made; essential networking
- **Integration:** Event calendar; investment opportunity feeds

### 5.4 ICC â€” International Chamber of Commerce (DRC Chapter)
- **Provides:** International trade facilitation, arbitration, business standards
- **Integration:** Trade documentation and standards

### 5.5 AmCham DRC â€” American Chamber of Commerce
- **Provides:** US business advocacy in DRC, networking events, trade promotion
- **Why:** Direct bridge to US investment community

---

## 6. PRIVATE INTELLIGENCE & CONSULTING

### 6.1 Africa Intelligence
- **URL:** https://www.africaintelligence.com/
- **Provides:** Premium intelligence on DRC politics, business deals, mining sector, power dynamics
- **Why:** Industry-leading intelligence service; breaks stories months before mainstream media
- **Integration:** **Paid subscription** â€” premium content worth it for authority; newsletter embeddable

### 6.2 Control Risks
- **URL:** https://www.controlrisks.com/
- **Provides:** Political risk assessments, security consulting, investment risk analysis for DRC
- **Why:** Global leader in political and security risk consulting
- **Integration:** Risk maps and reports (paid)

### 6.3 Verisk Maplecroft
- **URL:** https://www.maplecroft.com/
- **Provides:** Country risk indices, ESG risk data, human rights assessments
- **Why:** Quantitative risk scoring; used by institutional investors
- **Integration:** **API available** (paid) for risk score widgets

### 6.4 McKinsey & Company â€” Africa Practice
- **URL:** https://www.mckinsey.com/featured-insights/middle-east-and-africa
- **Provides:** Strategic analysis, "Lions on the Move" Africa reports, mining sector insights
- **Why:** Top management consultancy with dedicated Africa practice

### 6.5 Deloitte Africa
- **URL:** https://www2.deloitte.com/za/en.html
- **Provides:** Mining industry reports, tax guides, audit and advisory for DRC operations
- **Why:** Practical business and tax intelligence for investors

### 6.6 PwC â€” Mining Reports
- **URL:** https://www.pwc.com/gx/en/industries/energy-utilities-resources/mining.html
- **Provides:** "Mine" annual report, African mining insights, tax guides
- **Why:** Financial and operational insights for mining investors

### 6.7 EY â€” Africa Attractiveness Program
- **URL:** https://www.ey.com/en_za/attractiveness
- **Provides:** Africa investment attractiveness surveys, FDI tracking
- **Why:** Annual benchmark of African investment flows

---

## 7. NEWS & MEDIA SOURCES

### 7.1 Specialized DRC/Africa Sources

| Source | URL | Focus | Integration |
|--------|-----|-------|-------------|
| **ActualitÃ©.cd** | https://actualite.cd/ | DRC national news | RSS âœ… |
| **Radio Okapi** | https://www.radiookapi.net/ | UN-backed DRC news | RSS âœ… |
| **7sur7.cd** | https://7sur7.cd/ | DRC current affairs | RSS âœ… |
| **Jeune Afrique** | https://www.jeuneafrique.com/ | Pan-African (French) | RSS âœ… |
| **The Africa Report** | https://www.theafricareport.com/ | Pan-African (English) | RSS âœ… |
| **African Arguments** | https://africanarguments.org/ | Analysis & commentary | RSS âœ… |

### 7.2 Mining-Specific Media

| Source | URL | Focus | Integration |
|--------|-----|-------|-------------|
| **Mining.com** | https://www.mining.com/ | Global mining news | RSS âœ… |
| **Mining Weekly** | https://www.miningweekly.com/ | Southern/Central Africa mining | RSS âœ… |
| **Mining Technology** | https://www.mining-technology.com/ | Mining projects & tech | RSS âœ… |
| **Fastmarkets (Metal Bulletin)** | https://www.fastmarkets.com/ | Metal prices & news | API (paid) |
| **S&P Global Market Intelligence** | https://www.spglobal.com/marketintelligence/ | Mining data & analytics | API (paid) |

### 7.3 International Wire Services

| Source | URL | DRC Coverage |
|--------|-----|-------------|
| **Reuters Africa** | https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/ | Breaking DRC business/political news |
| **Bloomberg Africa** | https://www.bloomberg.com/africa | Financial/market DRC coverage |
| **AFP** | https://www.afp.com/ | French-language DRC wire service |
| **AP News Africa** | https://apnews.com/hub/africa | US perspective on DRC events |

---

## 8. DATA PROVIDERS & INTEGRATION

### 8.1 Free APIs (No Key / Free Tier)

| Provider | API | Data | URL |
|----------|-----|------|-----|
| **World Bank** | REST API | GDP, FDI, indicators | `http://api.worldbank.org/v2/country/CD` |
| **USGS** | Data portal | Mineral production | https://minerals.usgs.gov/ |
| **EITI** | Open data | Revenue transparency | https://eiti.org/data |
| **UN Comtrade** | REST API | Trade statistics | https://comtradeplus.un.org/ |
| **Open Exchange Rates** | REST API | Currency rates | https://openexchangerates.org/ |

### 8.2 Paid APIs (Worth Investing In)

| Provider | Data | Approx. Cost |
|----------|------|--------------|
| **S&P Global Market Intelligence** | Mining company data, reserves | $$$ |
| **LME** | Metal prices (cobalt, copper) | $$ |
| **Fastmarkets** | Commodity prices | $$ |
| **Africa Intelligence** | Premium intel | ~â‚¬500/yr |
| **Verisk Maplecroft** | Risk scores | $$$ |

### 8.3 RSS Feeds for News Aggregation
Most news sources listed in Section 7 offer RSS feeds. These can be aggregated into the website using:
- **n8n workflow** â†’ fetch RSS â†’ filter DRC content â†’ push to website CMS
- **WordPress RSS aggregator plugins** (if using WP)
- **Custom Node.js RSS parser** â†’ API endpoint for frontend

---

## 9. WEBSITE INTEGRATION GUIDE

### 9.1 Recommended Architecture

```
[RSS Feeds] â”€â”€â†’ [n8n Workflow] â”€â”€â†’ [Invest in DRC API] â”€â”€â†’ [Website Frontend]
[World Bank API] â”€â”€â†’ [n8n Workflow] â”€â”€â†—
[USGS Data] â”€â”€â†’ [n8n Workflow] â”€â”€â†—
[Manual Curation] â”€â”€â†’ [Admin CMS] â”€â”€â†—
```

### 9.2 Content Sections to Build

1. **News Feed** â€” Automated via RSS from Radio Okapi, ActualitÃ©.cd, Mining.com, Reuters Africa
2. **Economic Indicators** â€” World Bank API (GDP, FDI, inflation) â€” auto-updated
3. **Mineral Production Data** â€” USGS annual data â€” updated yearly
4. **Metal Prices Widget** â€” LME or free alternative for cobalt/copper spot prices
5. **Risk Dashboard** â€” Curated from EITI, World Bank governance indicators
6. **Events Calendar** â€” DRC Mining Week, Mining Indaba, other conferences
7. **Investment Guides** â€” Curated from ANAPI, World Bank, IMF reports
8. **Contact Directory** â€” Government contacts, embassies, trade bodies from this document

### 9.3 n8n Automation Workflows to Build

1. **DRC News Aggregator** â€” RSS feeds â†’ filter â†’ deduplicate â†’ push to CMS
2. **Economic Data Updater** â€” World Bank API â†’ format â†’ update dashboard (monthly)
3. **Price Tracker** â€” Metal prices â†’ format â†’ update widget (daily)
4. **Report Monitor** â€” Check think tank sites for new DRC publications (weekly)

### 9.4 Quick Wins for Website Enrichment

- [ ] Embed IPIS interactive mining maps
- [ ] Add World Bank data indicators widget
- [ ] Create DRC mining infographic from USGS data
- [ ] Build news ticker from RSS feeds
- [ ] Add event countdown for next DRC Mining Week
- [ ] Create "Key Contacts" directory from this document
- [ ] Link to US-DRC minerals agreement prominently

---

## APPENDIX: Key Minerals in DRC

| Mineral | DRC Global Share | Primary Use | Key Region |
|---------|-----------------|-------------|------------|
| **Cobalt** | ~70% | EV batteries, electronics | Katanga (Lualaba, Haut-Katanga) |
| **Copper** | Major producer | Construction, electronics | Katanga |
| **Coltan (Tantalum)** | ~60% | Capacitors, phones | Kivu provinces |
| **Diamond** | Top 5 producer | Jewelry, industrial | Kasai |
| **Gold** | Significant | Finance, jewelry | Ituri, Kivu |
| **Lithium** | Emerging | EV batteries | Manono (Tanganyika) |
| **Tin (Cassiterite)** | Top 10 | Electronics, plating | Kivu, Maniema |
| **Germanium** | Significant | Semiconductors, fiber optics | Katanga |

---

*Document compiled by Alex Prime for Invest in Congo project.*
*Sources verified as of March 2026. URLs should be periodically rechecked.*

## 1. Official Government Departments & Organizations

### Core Government Agencies

| Organization | Full Name | Website | Role | Contact |
|---|---|---|---|---|
| **MinistÃ¨re des Mines** | Ministry of Mines | [mines.gouv.cd](https://mines.gouv.cd/fr/) | Mining legislation, geological mapping, mineral resource promotion, technical monitoring of mining activities | Webmail: webmail.mines.gouv.cd Â· Kinshasa, Gombe |
| **CAMI** | Cadastre Minier (Mining Registry) | [cami.cd](https://cami.cd/) | Management of mining titles and rights; maintains the national mining cadastre file; processes new applications for mining and quarrying rights | Kinshasa Â· Guichet re-opened Feb 2, 2026 for new applications |
| **CAMI Map Portal** | DRC Mining Cadastre Map Portal | [drclicences.cami.cd](https://drclicences.cami.cd/fr/) | Interactive spatial view of all mining licences, permits, and concessions across DRC â€” essential for due diligence | Public access portal |
| **ANAPI** | Agence Nationale pour la Promotion des Investissements | [anapi.cd](https://anapi.cd/en/) | Investment promotion, business climate improvement, investor facilitation; provides investment guides, sector information, fiscal incentives | Under Ministry of Planning Â· info@anapi.cd |
| **ANAPI â€” Invest in DRC Portal** | Official DRC Investment Portal | [investindrc.cd](https://dev.investindrc.cd/en/index.php) | ANAPI's dedicated investment promotion site â€” sector guides, investment incentives, forums | Organized "Invest in DRC" International Forum (postponed from Feb 2025) |
| **GÃ©camines** | La GÃ©nÃ©rale des CarriÃ¨res et des Mines | [gecamines.cd](https://www.gecamines.cd/) | State-owned mining company; JV partner in most major copper-cobalt operations | Lubumbashi, Haut-Katanga |
| **EGC** | Entreprise GÃ©nÃ©rale du Cobalt | [egcobalt.cd](https://egcobalt.cd/) / [egcobalt.com](https://www.egcobalt.com/) | GÃ©camines subsidiary; state monopoly on artisanal cobalt sourcing, processing & export | Created 2019 by government decree |
| **SAEMAPE** | Service d'Assistance et d'Encadrement de l'Exploitation MiniÃ¨re Artisanale et Ã  Petite Ã‰chelle | [saemape.cd](https://saemape.cd/) | Supervision and support for artisanal & small-scale mining (ASM) | info@saemape.cd Â· +243 858 193 909 Â· Avenue de la Gombe NÂ°310, Kinshasa/Gombe |
| **BCC** | Banque Centrale du Congo | [bcc.cd](https://www.bcc.cd/) | Central bank; exchange rates, monetary policy, economic statistics, annual reports | Kinshasa Â· Publishes daily exchange rates |
| **DGDA** | Direction GÃ©nÃ©rale des Douanes et Accises | [douane.gouv.cd](https://douane.gouv.cd/dgda/) | Customs & excise; import/export regulations, tariff information | Kinshasa |
| **DGI** | Direction GÃ©nÃ©rale des ImpÃ´ts | [dgi.gouv.cd](https://www.dgi.gouv.cd/) | Tax administration; corporate tax regulations, fiscal regime for investors | Kinshasa |
| **GUICHET Unique** | One-Stop Shop for Business Creation | â€” | Streamlined business registration (coordinated by ANAPI) | Through ANAPI offices |

### DRC Embassies (Key Investment Points of Contact)

| Embassy | Website | Notes |
|---|---|---|

| **DRC Embassy â€” France** | [ambardc-paris.com](https://www.ambardc-paris.com/) | Key francophone business hub |

## 2. Mining Sector â€” Key Players & Data

| **Glencore** | ðŸ‡¨ðŸ‡­ Switzerland | Kamoto Copper Company (KCC), Mutanda Mining | Copper, Cobalt | [glencore.cd](https://www.glencore.cd/en) |

| **CMOC Group** (China Molybdenum) | ðŸ‡¨ðŸ‡³ China | Tenke Fungurume Mining (TFM) | Copper, Cobalt | [cmoc.com](https://www.cmoc.com/) |

| **Barrick Gold** | ðŸ‡¨ðŸ‡¦ Canada | Kibali Gold Mine (JV with AngloGold Ashanti & SOKIMO) | Gold | [barrick.com](https://www.barrick.com/) |

| **GÃ©camines** | ðŸ‡¨ðŸ‡© DRC (State) | Multiple JV partnerships across Katanga | Copper, Cobalt | [gecamines.cd](https://www.gecamines.cd/) |
| **SOKIMO** | ðŸ‡¨ðŸ‡© DRC (State) | Kibali Gold Mine (JV partner), Ituri Province | Gold | State-owned |

| Source | Website | Data Offered | Access Model |
|---|---|---|---|

## 3. International Organizations & Data Sources

### Multilateral Organizations

| Organization | DRC Page | Data & Reports Provided | API / Data Feed |
|---|---|---|---|
| **World Bank â€” DRC** | [worldbank.org/ext/en/country/drc](https://www.worldbank.org/ext/en/country/drc) | GDP growth, investment climate, project financing, development indicators, research publications | âœ… **World Bank Open Data API** â€” [data360.worldbank.org/en/api](https://data360.worldbank.org/en/api) Â· Free JSON/XML API with country-level economic indicators |
| **IMF â€” DRC** | [imf.org/en/Countries/COD](https://www.imf.org/en/Countries/COD) | Article IV consultations, economic outlook, fiscal data, debt sustainability analyses | âœ… **IMF Data API** â€” [data.imf.org](https://data.imf.org/) Â· Free API access to datasets (IFS, BOP, DOTS) |
| **African Development Bank â€” DRC** | [afdb.org/en/countries/central-africa/democratic-republic-congo](https://www.afdb.org/en/countries/central-africa/democratic-republic-congo) | Country economic outlook, infrastructure projects, private sector development reports | âœ… **AfDB Open Data Platform** â€” [dataportal.opendataforafrica.org](https://dataportal.opendataforafrica.org/) |
| **EITI â€” DRC** | [eiti.org/countries/democratic-republic-congo](https://eiti.org/countries/democratic-republic-congo) | Extractive sector revenue transparency; reports on ASM, state-owned enterprises, social/environmental obligations, infrastructure agreements | âœ… EITI publishes structured data; ITIE-RDC online portal: [tsl-itierdc.cd](https://www.tsl-itierdc.cd/) |
| **USGS â€” DRC Minerals Yearbook** | [pubs.usgs.gov/myb/vol3](https://pubs.usgs.gov/myb/vol3/2022/myb3-2022-congo-kinshasa.pdf) | Annual mineral production statistics, mine-level data, commodity summaries for DRC | âœ… **USGS Mineral Commodity Data API** â€” [data.usgs.gov/datacatalog](https://data.usgs.gov/datacatalog/) Â· Free CSV/JSON downloads |
| **UNCTAD** | [unctad.org](https://unctad.org/topic/investment/world-investment-report) | World Investment Report, FDI statistics for DRC | âœ… **UNCTADstat API** â€” [unctadstat.unctad.org](https://unctadstat.unctad.org/) |
| **UN MONUSCO** | [monusco.unmissions.org](https://monusco.unmissions.org/) | Security situation, conflict minerals monitoring, peacekeeping updates | RSS feeds available |
| **IPIS** (International Peace Information Service) | [ipisresearch.be](https://ipisresearch.be/) | Conflict minerals mapping, artisanal mining site data, interactive maps | âœ… **IPIS Interactive Map** â€” open access webmap & downloadable data |

### Due Diligence & Compliance Sources

| Source | Website | Purpose |
|---|---|---|
| **OECD Due Diligence Guidance** | [oecd.org/daf/inv/mne/mining.htm](https://www.oecd.org/daf/inv/mne/mining.htm) | Due diligence guidance for responsible supply chains from conflict-affected areas |

---

## 4. News & Information Services

### International News Agencies Covering DRC

| Source | Website | Focus | RSS / API |
|---|---|---|---|
| **Reuters Africa** | [reuters.com/world/africa](https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/) | Breaking news, mining deals, commodities, politics | âŒ No public RSS (login required); paid API available |
| **Bloomberg Africa** | [bloomberg.com/africa](https://www.bloomberg.com/africa) | Financial markets, investment news, commodity prices | âŒ Paid terminal; Bloomberg API for enterprise |
| **Africa Intelligence** | [africaintelligence.com](https://www.africaintelligence.com/) | Exclusive intelligence on African business, politics, and mining deals | âŒ Paid subscription; no public API |
| **Jeune Afrique** | [jeuneafrique.com](https://www.jeuneafrique.com/) | Francophone Africa business & politics, DRC coverage | âœ… RSS feeds available |
| **The Africa Report** | [theafricareport.com](https://www.theafricareport.com/) | Business, economy, investment across Africa | âœ… RSS feeds available |
| **Africa Confidential** | [africa-confidential.com](https://www.africa-confidential.com/) | Political risk, business intelligence | âŒ Paid subscription |

### Mining-Specific Media

| Source | Website | Focus | RSS / API |


---

## 7. Key Minerals Overview

DRC is endowed with over 50 identified mineral ores. The most strategically important include:

| Mineral | DRC Global Position | Key Producing Region | Primary Companies | Strategic Importance |
|---|---|---|---|---|
| **Cobalt** | ðŸ¥‡ #1 Producer (~70% of global supply) | Katanga (Haut-Katanga, Lualaba) | Glencore (KCC), CMOC (TFM), ERG, EGC (artisanal) | EV batteries, superalloys, electronics |
| **Copper** | ðŸ¥ˆ Top 5 Producer (rapidly growing) | Katanga | Ivanhoe (Kamoa-Kakula: 389kt in 2025), Glencore, CMOC | Electrification, renewables, construction |
| **Coltan (Tantalum)** | ðŸ¥‡ #1 (est. 60-80% of reserves) | Nord-Kivu, Sud-Kivu, Maniema | Artisanal miners; Rubaya deposit offered to US | Capacitors, electronics, aerospace |
| **Gold** | Major producer | Ituri (Kibali), Sud-Kivu | Barrick/AngloGold (Kibali: world-class), artisanal | Store of value, electronics, jewelry |
| **Tin (Cassiterite)** | Top 10 Producer | Nord-Kivu (Bisie) | Alphamin Resources | Solder, electronics, alloys |
| **Diamonds** | Top 10 Producer | KasaÃ¯, Tshopo | MIBA (state), artisanal | Gems & industrial |
| **Lithium** | Emerging (significant deposits identified) | Manono (Tanganyika) | AVZ Minerals (disputed), various exploration | EV batteries (critical for energy transition) |
| **Tungsten** | Significant producer | Eastern DRC | Artisanal, various | Hardmetals, electronics, military |
| **Germanium** | Major producer | Katanga | ERG, byproduct of copper-cobalt | Fiber optics, solar cells, semiconductors |

---

## 8. US-DRC Critical Minerals Agreement (2025)

### Background

In **December 2025**, the DRC, the United States, and Rwanda signed three agreements described as a milestone for peace and economic integration. Key elements:

- **US-DRC Minerals Cooperation Framework**: The DRC offered a shortlist of strategic mining assets to the United States, including the **Rubaya coltan mine** (one of the world's richest tantalum deposits, currently under M23/rebel control in Nord-Kivu).
- **Glencore Stake Acquisition**: A preliminary commercial agreement was reached for US-backed interests to acquire a **40% stake in Mutanda Mining and Kamoto Copper Company** (Glencore's two largest DRC operations).
- **US Government Mining Vehicle**: Reports indicate the US government plans to establish a **new mining entity** to operate in Africa's Copperbelt (DRC and Zambia) to secure critical mineral supply chains.

### Key Sources to Track This Developing Story

| Source | URL | What They Cover |
|---|---|---|
| **Reuters â€” DRC Minerals** | [reuters.com/world/africa](https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/) | Breaking news on US-DRC deals; exclusive reporting on Rubaya mine |
| **Public Citizen (Analysis)** | [citizen.org/article/critical-minerals-and-contested-sovereignty](https://www.citizen.org/article/critical-minerals-and-contested-sovereignty/) | Critical analysis of sovereignty issues in the agreements |
| **Oakland Institute** | [oaklandinstitute.org](https://www.oaklandinstitute.org/) | "Shafted: The Scramble for Critical Minerals in the DRC" report |
| **openDemocracy** | [opendemocracy.net](https://www.opendemocracy.net/) | Analysis of who benefits from US critical minerals push |
| **US Congress** | [congress.gov](https://www.congress.gov/) | Congressional letters and hearings on DRC minerals deal |
| **Mining.com** | [mining.com](https://www.mining.com/) | Coverage of US mining entity for Africa's Copperbelt |

### Implications for "Invest in DRC"
- The US-DRC agreement signals a **major geopolitical shift** in DRC mining from Chinese to Western investment
- Creates opportunities for new **JV structures** and investment vehicles
- Raises concerns about **sovereignty, conflict minerals, and community impact** that the platform should address transparently
- Track developments via Reuters, Mining.com, and ANAPI for official government positions

---

## Appendix A: Quick-Start Integration Checklist

For the Invest in DRC website/platform, prioritize these integrations:

### Phase 1 â€” Immediate (Free / Low Effort)
- [ ] Embed **TradingView** commodity price widgets (copper, cobalt)
- [ ] Set up **RSS aggregation** from Mining.com, ActualitÃ©.CD, Desk Eco, Radio Okapi
- [ ] Iframe embed **CAMI Mining Map Portal**
- [ ] Integrate **World Bank API** for key economic indicators dashboard
- [ ] Link to **ANAPI investment guides** and sector information

### Phase 2 â€” Medium Term
- [ ] Build **IMF Data API** integration for fiscal/monetary dashboards
- [ ] Create **mining company directory** with profiles and links
- [ ] Embed **IPIS interactive maps** for conflict minerals transparency
- [ ] Set up **n8n workflows** for automated data collection and caching
- [ ] Add **EITI DRC** extractive revenue data visualization

### Phase 3 â€” Advanced
- [ ] Negotiate API access with **S&P Global** or **GlobalData** for mine-level data
- [ ] Build custom **news scoring/filtering** algorithm for DRC-relevant content
- [ ] Develop **investment calculator** using World Bank/BCC data (exchange rates, tax rates)
- [ ] Create **investment opportunity pipeline** from ANAPI + mining company announcements

---

## Appendix B: Key Contacts Summary

| Entity | Primary Contact Method | Notes |
|---|---|---|
| **ANAPI** | info@anapi.cd Â· [anapi.cd/en](https://anapi.cd/en/) | First stop for foreign investors |
| **CAMI** | [cami.cd](https://cami.cd/) | Mining title applications & searches |
| **SAEMAPE** | info@saemape.cd Â· +243 858 193 909 | Artisanal mining regulation |
| **FEC** | [fec-rdc.com](https://fec-rdc.com/) | Business federation membership |
| **Ministry of Mines** | [mines.gouv.cd](https://mines.gouv.cd/fr/) | Policy & regulation |
| **BCC** | [bcc.cd](https://www.bcc.cd/) | Exchange rates, monetary data |
| **DRC Embassy USA** | [ambadrcusa.org](https://www.ambadrcusa.org/) | US-based investment inquiries |

---

> âš ï¸ **Note on ANAPI website**: The original domain `anapi.org` appears to have been compromised (showing unrelated casino content as of March 2026). The **correct official ANAPI website is now [anapi.cd](https://anapi.cd/en/)** and the investment portal at [investindrc.cd](https://dev.investindrc.cd/en/index.php).

files.name: NEXUS-AI-ACADEMY-BRIEF.md
files.content:
# Nexus AI Academy â€” Project Brief

## What It Is

Nexus AI Academy is a full-featured Learning Management System (LMS) built primarily for the French-speaking market. It's a web application where users can browse, enroll in, and complete online courses with rich multimedia content, progress tracking, quizzes, certificates, and AI-powered tutoring.

**Live tech stack**: Next.js 15, TypeScript, Prisma ORM, SQLite/PostgreSQL, NextAuth v5, Tailwind CSS, Stripe payments, OpenAI integration.

**Languages**: French (primary), English, German, Spanish â€” full i18n support.

## What Makes It Special: AI-Powered Course Creation

The core differentiator of this platform is that **administrators don't manually create courses**. Instead:

1. An admin provides high-level course information (topic, target audience, desired structure)
2. AI agents automatically generate the full course structure â€” modules, lessons, content sections, quizzes, case studies, and exercises
3. The system creates all the structured content needed for a world-class tutorial experience
4. The generated course is uploaded and published to the platform, ready for students

This means the platform can scale course creation dramatically without requiring subject matter experts to manually author every lesson, section, and quiz. The AI handles the heavy lifting of content structuring and generation.

### Course Import Pipelines

The system supports multiple ways to get courses into the platform:

- **HTML Import**: Upload structured HTML files that get parsed into courses, modules, and lessons with content blocks
- **Airtable Integration**: Sync course data from Airtable bases, including structured lessons with sections, video prompts, case studies, and exercise projects
- **Unified Bulk Import**: Import multiple courses at once through a single interface
- **Structured Lesson System**: A rich content model that goes beyond basic lessons â€” each lesson can have typed sections (Introduction, Concept, Example, Practice, etc.), visual elements, interactive components, video production specs, case studies, and step-by-step exercise projects

## Platform Features

### For Students
- Browse and search a course catalog
- Enroll in courses (free or paid via Stripe)
- Learn through rich multimedia lessons (HTML, video, audio, code, interactive content)
- Track progress at the lesson, module, and course level
- Take quizzes and assessments
- Download course resources
- Chat with AI-powered course assistants (each course can have its own AI tutor)
- Book 1-on-1 sessions with human instructors
- Earn certificates upon course completion

### For Instructors
- Create and manage their own courses
- Import course content from HTML files
- Set availability for 1-on-1 booking sessions
- Configure session types and pricing
- View student enrollments and progress

### For Administrators
- Full user management (roles: Student, Instructor, Admin)
- Course approval and moderation system
- Bulk course import interface
- AI-powered course generation
- Analytics dashboard
- Content moderation tools
- Coupon and promotion management
- Email campaign system

## How the Course Structure Works

```
Course
â”œâ”€â”€ Module 1
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ Lesson 1
â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ Content Block (HTML text)
â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ Content Block (Video)
â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ Content Block (Quiz)
â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ Content Block (Code example)
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ Lesson 2
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ Assessment (Module quiz)
â”œâ”€â”€ Module 2
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ ...
â””â”€â”€ AI Instructor (chatbot tutor for this course)
```

Each lesson can also have a **Structured Lesson** record that provides:
- Typed sections (Introduction, Concept, Demonstration, Practice, Conclusion)
- Visual element specifications (images, diagrams, animations)
- Interactive elements (quizzes, reflection prompts, code editors)
- Video production prompts (scene descriptions, graphics specs, B-roll suggestions)
- Case studies with background, challenge, solution, and results
- Exercise projects broken into guided steps

## Payment & Business Model

- Stripe integration for course purchases (EUR currency, French VAT compliance)
- Support for coupons, promotions, and time-limited discounts
- Course packages/bundles
- Instructor session booking with configurable pricing
- Subscription tiers (Free, Premium, Enterprise)

## Authentication & Access Control

- Email/password registration with email verification
- OAuth via Google and GitHub
- Role-based access (Student, Instructor, Admin)
- Course enrollment verification â€” students must be enrolled to access learning content
- Profile completion enforcement after registration
- Protected admin routes with role checks

## Real-Time & AI Features

- **AI Course Assistants**: Each course can have an AI instructor powered by OpenAI that students can chat with for help
- **Firebase Chat**: Real-time messaging infrastructure
- **Pusher**: Real-time event broadcasting

## Current State

The platform is functional with:
- Complete auth system with three test user roles
- Course browsing, enrollment, and learning interface
- Course import from HTML and Airtable
- Progress tracking
- Payment integration
- Booking system for instructor sessions
- Admin dashboard
- i18n support for 4 languages

The main area of active development is the AI-powered course generation pipeline â€” making it seamless for admins to go from a course idea to a fully structured, published course with minimal manual effort.

files.name: PULSE-ARCHITECTS-BRIEF.md
files.content:
# ALEX BRIEFING â€” Pulse Architects

This document is the comprehensive briefing for Alex, the AI assistant working on the Pulse Architects project. It contains everything you need to know about the business, brand, platform, and product offering.

---

## 1. COMPANY OVERVIEW

**Company Name:** Pulse Architects
**Domain:** pulse-architects.com
**Location:** 3 Avenue Jacques Prevert, 77200 Torcy, France
**Phone:** +33 6 12 77 64 98
**Email:** chicco007@PulseArchitects.com
**Social:** Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn (@pulse_architects)

**What we do:** Pulse Architects is a digital marketplace and one-stop shop for premium, ready-made architectural plans covering every type of building â€” from single-family homes and luxury villas to 10-story commercial buildings, palaces, apartment complexes, office spaces, and full site developments. Customers purchase plans digitally, download them instantly, and get everything they need to begin construction.

**Experience:** 25+ years in the architectural industry.
**Team:** 50+ licensed architects on staff.
**Catalog size:** 5,000+ architectural plans.
**Awards:** 100+ design awards won.
**Customer satisfaction:** 4.9/5 from 10,000+ customers.

---

## 2. VISION & MISSION

**Vision:** To be the world's most comprehensive and trusted digital source for premium architectural plans, making professional-grade building designs accessible to anyone â€” homeowner, developer, or builder â€” anywhere in the world.

**Mission:** Transforming visions into architectural reality through innovative design and meticulous attention to detail. We combine cutting-edge design with practical functionality to create blueprints that inspire and endure. Every plan is meticulously designed by licensed architects who understand the importance of both form and function.

**Core promise:** "We're committed to helping builders, developers, and homeowners bring their vision to life with confidence."

---

## 3. COMPANY VALUES

1. **Architectural Excellence** â€” Every plan is crafted by licensed architects with decades of experience in residential and commercial design.
2. **Client-Centered Design** â€” We prioritize lifestyle needs, creating spaces that enhance how people live, work, and connect.
3. **Award-Winning Quality** â€” Designs recognized with multiple architectural awards and featured in leading publications.
4. **Innovation & Sustainability** â€” Forward-thinking designs incorporating sustainable building practices and smart home technology.

---

## 4. TARGET AUDIENCE

- **Homeowners** building custom homes or renovating
- **Property developers** working on residential and commercial projects
- **Builders and contractors** who need professional-grade plans
- **Architects** seeking plan templates as starting points
- **Real estate professionals** developing land and properties
- **Government/institutional** clients needing schools, healthcare, government buildings

---

## 5. PRODUCT OFFERING

### What customers buy
Complete, ready-made architectural plan packages. Each package is a comprehensive documentation set that includes everything needed for construction and building permit applications.

### What's included in every plan package
- Detailed floor plans and elevations
- Roof plans
- Foundation plans
- Structural drawings and specifications
- Electrical layouts
- Plumbing plans
- Section drawings
- Construction details
- Material specifications
- 3D renders and visualizations (exterior and interior)
- Building views from all angles
- Building permit-ready documents
- Multiple file formats: PDF, DWG (AutoCAD), RVT (Revit)

### Plan categories and catalog depth
| Category | Plan Count | Subcategories |
|---|---|---|
| Residential Plans | 2,845 | Single Family, Multi-Family, Tiny Homes, Luxury Estates |
| Commercial Buildings | 1,256 | Office Buildings, Retail, Restaurants, Hotels |
| Sustainable Design | 891 | Net Zero, Passive House, LEED, Green Roofs |
| Institutional | 678 | Schools, Healthcare, Government, Religious |
| Historic & Traditional | 423 | Victorian, Colonial, Craftsman, Art Deco |
| Waterfront & Coastal | 334 | Beach Houses, Lake Homes, Marina, Flood Resistant |

### License types
| License | Description |
|---|---|
| PREVIEW | Free preview download |
| STANDARD | Single-use license for one construction project |
| COMMERCIAL | Commercial construction rights |
| EXTENDED | Extended rights with higher download limits |

### Plan card attributes
Each plan displays: title, description, price, number of bedrooms, number of bathrooms, total area (sq ft).

---

## 6. SERVICES

### Core services
1. **Architectural Plans** â€” Premium ready-made plans for residential and commercial projects. Code-compliant, multi-format.
2. **3D Renders & Visualizations** â€” Photorealistic exterior renders, interior walkthroughs, material/lighting studies, VR presentations.
3. **Building Permits & Certificates** â€” Permit applications, zoning compliance, environmental impact assessments, fire/safety certifications.

### Additional services
- **Consultation Services** â€” Expert architectural consultation for custom projects and modifications.
- **Custom Modifications** â€” Team can modify existing plans or create completely custom designs. Standard mods take 2-3 weeks; fully custom designs take 6-12 weeks.
- **Sustainable Design** â€” Green building certifications and sustainable architecture solutions.
- **Design Awards Program** â€” Submit projects for architectural design awards.
- **Digital Asset Library** â€” Extensive library of architectural components and materials.
- **Fast-Track Services** â€” Expedited design and delivery for time-sensitive projects.
- **Construction Support** â€” Contractor selection, document review, site visits, quality control inspections.

### Service process (4 steps)
1. **Consultation** â€” Understand requirements and vision.
2. **Design** â€” Create detailed plans and specifications.
3. **Review** â€” Collaborate on revisions until perfect.
4. **Delivery** â€” Final delivery of all files, permits, and documentation.

---

## 7. KEY SELLING POINTS

These are the six pillars used across marketing:

1. **Professional Quality** â€” All plans created by licensed architects, compliant with international building codes and safety standards.
2. **Instant Download** â€” Plans delivered immediately after purchase with secure digital delivery and lifetime access to updates.
3. **Complete Documentation** â€” Floor plans, elevations, sections, construction details, and material specs all included.
4. **Expert Support** â€” 24/7 customer support and consultation with experienced architects.
5. **Award-Winning Designs** â€” Multiple architectural awards, featured in leading design publications.
6. **Fast Delivery** â€” Most plans delivered within minutes; custom mods available within 48 hours.

---

## 8. BRAND VOICE & MESSAGING

### Tone
Professional, confident, aspirational. The brand speaks with authority (25+ years, licensed architects, awards) while remaining approachable and client-focused.

### Key taglines and phrases
- "Premium Architectural Plans"
- "Design Your Dream"
- "Transforming visions into reality"
- "Crafting architectural excellence"
- "Where architectural mastery meets unparalleled elegance"
- "Enter a realm where exquisite design and timeless luxury comes together"
- "Ready to Start Building?"
- "Ready to build your dream home?"
- "Transform your vision into reality"

### Marketing scroll strip messages
- "Browse thousands of premium architectural plans at exceptional prices"
- "Get a free architectural consultation"
- "Custom design your dream home"
- "Award-winning designs by licensed architects"
- "Instant download with lifetime access"
- "Professional quality guaranteed"

---

## 9. LEADERSHIP TEAM

| Name | Role | Credentials |
|---|---|---|
| Sarah Johnson | Principal Architect | AIA Licensed, 20+ years experience |
| Michael Chen | Design Director | NCARB Certified, 18+ years experience |
| Emily Rodriguez | Sustainable Design Lead | LEED AP, 15+ years experience |

---

## 10. SOCIAL PROOF & TESTIMONIALS

**Customer rating:** 4.9/5 from 10,000+ satisfied customers.

**Testimonial 1 â€” Emily & John Smith (Homeowners):**
Found their perfect architectural design. Plans were detailed, layouts accurate, process seamless. Design team answered all questions professionally.

**Testimonial 2 â€” Sam & Mickay John (Property Developers):**
Delivered their dream home design. Plans thorough, 3D visualizations spot-on, entire process smooth. Outstanding customer service addressing all requirements with expertise.

---

## 11. PLATFORM & TECHNOLOGY

### Tech stack
- Next.js 15.5 (App Router) / React 19 / TypeScript
- Tailwind CSS with Homely design system
- Prisma ORM (SQLite dev, PostgreSQL production)
- NextAuth v5 (Google OAuth + credentials)
- Stripe payments
- Cloudinary for image/file hosting
- Resend for transactional emails
- next-intl for i18n (English + French)
- Zustand for cart state management
- Framer Motion for animations
- Vercel for hosting

### User roles
| Role | Access |
|---|---|
| CUSTOMER | Browse, purchase, download plans, manage orders |
| ARCHITECT | Upload and manage plan content |
| ADMIN | Content management, analytics, user management |
| SUPER_ADMIN | Full system access |

### E-commerce flow
1. Customer browses catalog (filterable by category, specs, price)
2. Adds plans to cart (Zustand store, persisted to localStorage)
3. Checkout: enters details, selects payment (Card or PayPal via Stripe)
4. Order confirmed, license key generated
5. Instant digital delivery with secure download links
6. Download tracking and email confirmation sent

### Dashboard capabilities (Admin)
- Analytics: total users, images uploaded, downloads today, total downloads
- Track downloads by license type
- Image status management (Approved, Pending, Rejected)
- Content upload and moderation
- Site settings configuration

### Design system
- **Font:** Bricolage Grotesque
- **Colors:** Primary green #07be8a, Sky blue #79adff, Light sky blue #9cc2dd, Dark #172023
- **Dark mode:** Class-based toggle, default light
- **Template reference:** Homely NextJS Tailwind v1 (must be used for all new sections)

---

## 12. CONTENT AREAS

### Website pages
| Page | Purpose |
|---|---|
| Homepage | Hero, features, testimonials, CTAs, luxury showcase |
| About | Mission, stats, team, values, FAQ |
| Services | Core + additional services, process steps |
| Catalog | Browsable plan marketplace with filters |
| Gallery | Portfolio showcase (50K+ views, 2K+ downloads, 5K+ likes) |
| Blog | Architectural insights, trends, sustainability, technology |
| Contact | Form, phone, email, address |
| Auth | Login, register, email verification |
| Dashboard | User orders, admin analytics/content management |
| Checkout | Multi-step purchase flow |

### Blog topics covered
- Modern architecture trends
- Sustainable design principles
- Smart home integration
- Property market insights

### Gallery categories
- All Projects, Architectural Plans, Residential, Commercial, Luxury

---

## 13. FAQ REFERENCE

**Q: Can plans be customized?**
A: Yes. All plans can be customized for specific needs, site requirements, and design preferences. Licensed architects modify existing plans or create fully custom designs.

**Q: What's included in architectural plans?**
A: Floor plans, elevations, sections, construction details, structural drawings, electrical layouts, plumbing plans, material specifications, 3D visualizations, and building permit-ready documents.

**Q: How long does custom design take?**
A: Standard modifications: 2-3 weeks. Fully custom designs: 6-12 weeks depending on complexity. Detailed timelines provided during initial consultation.

**Q: Is construction support available?**
A: Yes. Contractor selection assistance, construction document review, site visits, and quality control inspections are offered.

---

## 14. COMPETITIVE POSITIONING

Pulse Architects positions itself as a **premium, comprehensive, professional-grade** alternative in the architectural plans market. The differentiators are:

- **Breadth:** Plans for literally any building type â€” homes, villas, apartments, commercial, institutional, palaces, site developments
- **Completeness:** Every package includes everything (plans, renders, permits docs, multiple formats)
- **Credibility:** Licensed architects, 25+ years, 100+ awards, code-compliant
- **Convenience:** Instant digital delivery, lifetime updates, 24/7 support
- **Flexibility:** Ready-made plans + custom modification services + fully custom design

The platform is a **one-stop shop** for anyone involved in construction â€” from a first-time homeowner to a large-scale real estate developer.

---

*This briefing is excluded from version control. Last updated: February 2026.*

## 3. Services We Offer (9 Services)
