### 3.1 Logo Design & Brand Identity
Create memorable logos that capture a brand's essence.

| Tier | Price | Includes |
|------|-------|----------|
| Starter | 497 EUR | 2 concepts, 2 revisions, basic files |
| Professional | 997 EUR | 5 concepts, unlimited revisions, full brand mark variations, social media kit, brand guidelines |
| Enterprise | 2,497 EUR | 8 concepts, unlimited revisions, full brand identity system, 40+ page brand book, animated logo, stationery design |

**Delivery time:** Starter 5-7 days, Professional 10-14 days, Enterprise 3-4 weeks
**Key selling point:** Client owns full copyright of the final logo upon delivery.

### 3.2 Website Design & Development
Fast, beautiful, conversion-optimized websites on every device.

| Tier | Price | Includes |
|------|-------|----------|
| Starter | 1,497 EUR | Up to 5 pages, responsive, basic SEO, contact form, 1 month support |
| Professional | 2,997 EUR | Up to 15 pages, CMS (WordPress/headless), blog, advanced SEO, 90+ Lighthouse score, 3 months support |
| Enterprise | 5,997 EUR | Unlimited pages, custom web app features, e-commerce, multi-language, advanced animations, API integrations, 12 months priority support |

**Tech stack:** Next.js, React, Tailwind CSS, headless CMS. Also WordPress for simpler sites.
**Delivery time:** Starter 2-3 weeks, Professional 4-6 weeks, Enterprise 8-12 weeks

### 3.3 Branding & Visual Identity
Complete visual identity systems beyond just a logo.

| Tier | Price | Includes |
|------|-------|----------|
| Starter | 997 EUR | Brand workshop, color palette, typography, 10-page guidelines, business card |
| Professional | 2,497 EUR | Competitive analysis, full color + typography systems, photography style guide, brand voice framework, stationery suite, 30+ page brand book |
| Enterprise | 4,997 EUR | In-depth brand strategy, complete visual identity, brand architecture, custom iconography, environmental/signage guidelines, 60+ page brand book, launch strategy |

### 3.4 Print Design & Collateral
Business cards, brochures, posters, packaging.

| Tier | Price | Includes |
|------|-------|----------|
| Starter | 297 EUR | Business card + letterhead, 2 revisions, print-ready files |
| Professional | 697 EUR | Full stationery suite, brochure/flyer, poster/banner, unlimited revisions, print supervision |
| Enterprise | 1,497 EUR | Complete print system, packaging design, catalog (40 pages), event materials, custom illustrations, production management |

### 3.5 T-Shirt & Merchandise Design
Wearable art from streetwear drops to corporate merch.

| Tier | Price | Includes |
|------|-------|----------|
| Starter | 197 EUR | 1 custom design, 2 revisions, print-ready file, 1 mockup |
| Professional | 497 EUR | 3 designs, unlimited revisions, photorealistic mockups, printer guidance |
| Enterprise | 1,497 EUR | Full merch line (8+ designs), t-shirts/hoodies/hats/accessories, custom labels, lookbook, production management |

**Print methods supported:** Screen printing, DTG, sublimation, embroidery, heat transfer vinyl.

### 3.6 Motion Graphics & Animation
Logo animations, explainer videos, social motion content.

| Tier | Price | Includes |
|------|-------|----------|
| Starter | 497 EUR | Logo animation (5s) or 1 social media motion graphic, MP4/MOV/GIF |
| Professional | 1,497 EUR | 60s explainer video or 5 social motion graphics, storyboarding, voiceover, music, unlimited revisions |
| Enterprise | 3,997 EUR | 3-min explainer video, full animated campaign, character design, 3D motion, multi-platform delivery, dedicated motion director |

**Tools:** After Effects, Cinema 4D, Lottie, Rive, Framer Motion.

### 3.7 Infographic Design
Complex data transformed into clear, shareable visuals.

| Tier | Price | Includes |
|------|-------|----------|
| Starter | 297 EUR | 1 custom infographic, web-optimized PNG & PDF |
| Professional | 697 EUR | 3 infographics, data analysis, custom icons, animated GIF versions |
| Enterprise | 1,497 EUR | 7+ infographics or dashboards, interactive web infographics (HTML/CSS/JS), multi-language, template system |

### 3.8 Social Media Design
Scroll-stopping content for Instagram, LinkedIn, TikTok, YouTube, etc.

| Tier | Price | Includes |
|------|-------|----------|
| Starter | 297 EUR | 5 post templates + 2 story templates, editable in Canva/Figma |
| Professional | 797 EUR | 15 posts, 8 stories/reels, 3 carousels, 4 YouTube thumbnails, 2 ad sets, content calendar |
| Enterprise | 1,997 EUR/month | 30+ posts/month, full content library, ad campaigns, A/B variants, monthly performance review, 48-hour turnaround, dedicated designer |

### 3.9 Presentation Design
Pitch decks, keynotes, sales presentations.

| Tier | Price | Includes |
|------|-------|----------|
| Starter | 297 EUR | Up to 15 slides, custom template, data visualization, PowerPoint & PDF |
| Professional | 697 EUR | Up to 30 slides, narrative structure + copywriting, custom icons, all formats (PPT/Keynote/Slides) |
| Enterprise | 1,497 EUR | Unlimited slides, investor pitch deck, animated transitions, reusable template system, presentation coaching |

---

## 4. The Design Shop (Digital Products)

The website has an online shop selling premium digital design resources. These are passive income products that clients can buy without a consultation.

### Shop Categories

1. **Website Templates** - Responsive templates built with Next.js/Tailwind
2. **Social Media Kits** - Ready-to-use templates for Instagram, LinkedIn, etc.
3. **Brand Kits** - Complete brand identity packages with logo templates
4. **Presentation Templates** - Pitch decks for PowerPoint & Keynote
5. **Print Templates** - Business cards, flyers, brochures (print-ready)
6. **UI Kits** - Component libraries for Figma and Sketch
7. **Mockups** - Photorealistic device and branding mockups
8. **Icon Packs** - Curated icon sets for web and mobile

### Current Products in the Shop

| Product | Price | Category | Notes |
|---------|-------|----------|-------|
| Startup Landing Page Template | 49 EUR (was 79) | Website Templates | Next.js, dark/light mode, SEO optimized. **BESTSELLER** |
| Agency Portfolio Template | 59 EUR | Website Templates | Masonry grid, project detail pages, multi-language |
| Instagram Starter Kit | 29 EUR (was 45) | Social Media Kits | 50+ templates, Figma & Canva. **BESTSELLER** |
| LinkedIn Content Pack | 25 EUR | Social Media Kits | 30+ carousel templates, profile banners |
| Minimal Brand Kit | 69 EUR (was 99) | Brand Kits | 10 logo variations, style guide, business card designs |
| Pitch Deck Pro | 35 EUR | Presentation Templates | 40 slides, PPT & Keynote. **BESTSELLER** |
| Business Card Collection | 19 EUR | Print Templates | 20 designs, print-ready 300 DPI, CMYK |
| Dashboard UI Kit | 79 EUR (was 120) | UI Kits | 100+ components, dark/light mode, Figma. **NEW** |
| Device Mockup Bundle | 39 EUR | Mockups | 50 scenes, smart objects, 4K resolution |
| Essential Icon Set | 29 EUR | Icon Packs | 500+ icons, 3 styles, SVG/PNG/font. **NEW** |

**Price range:** 19 EUR to 79 EUR
**All products include commercial license.**

---

## 5. Portfolio Highlights (Case Studies to Reference)

Use these when pitching to demonstrate credibility and results:

### Zenith Capital Partners - Brand Identity
- Investment firm rebrand
- **Result:** Client acquisition increased 40% in 6 months
- Won them 2 major institutional partnerships

### NovaTech Solutions - Website
- B2B SaaS company site redesign
- **Result:** Demo requests up 280%, bounce rate dropped from 70% to 35%, 98 Lighthouse performance score

### Flora Luxe Cosmetics - Logo Design
- Premium organic cosmetics logo
- **Result:** Featured in Packaging of the World, secured shelf space in 150+ pharmacies in France, 78% brand recall

### Eco Collective - Full Brand Creation
- Sustainable fashion startup, from naming to website
- **Result:** Featured in Vogue France and Elle, Kickstarter raised 350% of goal

### Solaris Energy - Pitch Deck
- Investor pitch deck for renewable energy startup
- **Result:** Closed a 4.2M EUR Series A round. Investors cited the deck quality as a factor.

### UrbanFit Athletics - Social Media
- Fitness apparel social media design system
- **Result:** Instagram engagement from 1.2% to 5.8% in 3 months, gained 45,000 followers

### Maison Rouge Vineyards - Packaging
- Premium wine label redesign
- **Result:** 55% increase in international sales, Silver Medal at International Wine Label Design Awards

### Azure Dreams Travel - Website
- Luxury travel agency website
- **Result:** Online bookings up 190%, average booking value up 35%, won CSS Design Award for Best UX

---

## 6. Our Process (4 Steps)

When explaining how we work to prospects:

1. **Discovery** - We learn about the client's business, goals, audience, and competition
2. **Design** - We create concepts and present them for feedback
3. **Refine** - We iterate based on client feedback until it's perfect
4. **Deliver** - We hand over production-ready files with all formats needed

---

## 7. Target Clients

### Primary Targets
- **Startups** looking for brand identity, logos, and websites to launch
- **SMBs/SMEs** needing professional design to compete with bigger brands
- **Tech companies** (SaaS, AI, fintech) needing websites and pitch decks
- **Luxury/premium brands** (cosmetics, fashion, wine, hospitality)
- **Restaurants & food businesses** needing menus, packaging, social content

### Secondary Targets
- **Agencies** that need white-label design support
- **Freelancers** buying shop products (templates, kits, icons)
- **E-commerce brands** needing packaging and product photography
- **Event companies** needing materials (booths, banners, badges)
- **Consultants/coaches** needing pitch decks and LinkedIn content

### Geographic Focus
- Primary: France (Ile-de-France, Paris region)
- Secondary: Europe-wide (we work in EN and FR)
- Tertiary: International (15+ countries served)

---

## 8. Competitive Advantages (Talking Points)

When pitching Pulse Graphix, emphasize these:

1. **21+ years of experience** - Chicco has been in tech and design for over two decades
2. **Bilingual (EN/FR)** - We serve both French and international clients seamlessly
3. **Full-service** - Logo to website to social media to print, all under one roof. Clients don't need 5 different vendors.
4. **Results-driven** - Every case study includes measurable business results (not just pretty pictures)
5. **Modern tech stack** - Next.js, Tailwind CSS, Framer Motion. Websites we build are fast and future-proof
6. **98% client satisfaction** - Track record speaks for itself
7. **Premium website** - Our own site is beautifully designed with animated shader backgrounds, motion effects, and a polished UI (it's a showcase of what we can do)
8. **Digital shop** - Passive income channel selling templates and design resources

---

## 9. How to Book a Client

1. Direct them to the website: https://pulsegraphix.net
2. They can browse services, view portfolio case studies, and see pricing
3. Book a free consultation via Calendly: https://calendly.com/pulsegraphix
4. Or email directly: chicco@pulsegraphix.net
5. Phone: +33 6 12 77 64 98

---

## 10. Pricing Quick Reference

| Service | Starter | Professional | Enterprise |
|---------|---------|-------------|------------|
| Logo Design | 497 | 997 | 2,497 |
| Website | 1,497 | 2,997 | 5,997 |
| Branding | 997 | 2,497 | 4,997 |
| Print Design | 297 | 697 | 1,497 |
| Merch Design | 197 | 497 | 1,497 |
| Motion Graphics | 497 | 1,497 | 3,997 |
| Infographics | 297 | 697 | 1,497 |
| Social Media | 297 | 797 | 1,997/mo |
| Presentations | 297 | 697 | 1,497 |

*All prices in EUR.*

---

## 11. Brand Voice Guidelines

When communicating on behalf of Pulse Graphix, the tone should be:

- **Bold** - We're confident in what we deliver
- **Approachable** - Not stiff or corporate, we're human
- **Professional** - We know our craft and our numbers prove it
- **Innovative** - We use cutting-edge tools and techniques
- **Results-focused** - Always tie back to business outcomes, not just aesthetics

**Avoid:** Generic design jargon, overpromising, being pushy, discounting aggressively.

**Brand colors:** Neon Green (#00FF00) on Black (#0D0D0D). Clean, bold, modern.

---

## 12. FAQ for Prospects

**"Why should I choose Pulse Graphix over a freelancer on Fiverr?"**
We deliver strategic design backed by 21 years of experience and measurable business results. Our case studies show 40-280% improvements in key metrics. A cheap logo is just a drawing; we build brands.

**"Can you do just one service, or do I need a full package?"**
Each service is standalone. You can start with a logo and come back for a website later. But bundled projects get better consistency and often better value.

**"Do you work with clients outside of France?"**
Yes. We serve 15+ countries. The website is fully bilingual (EN/FR). Remote collaboration works seamlessly.

**"What's included in the free consultation?"**
A 30-minute call to understand the project, discuss goals, review timeline and budget, and recommend the right service tier. No commitment required.

**"Do you offer payment plans?"**
For larger projects (Professional and Enterprise tiers), we typically work with 50% upfront and 50% on delivery. Custom arrangements can be discussed.

---

*This document contains everything you need to effectively represent Pulse Graphix. If a prospect asks something not covered here, loop in Chicco directly.*

## ðŸ› ï¸ TOOLS & RESOURCES EXTRACTED

### AI Design Tools

| **Nano Banana Pro** | AI image gen, 3D mockups, product shots | Google DeepMind | Free/Paid |
| **GPT 5.1** | Fast AI for small edits | openai.com | Paid |

### Design Enhancement Tools
| Tool | Purpose | URL |
|------|---------|-----|
| **Unicorn Studio** | WebGL animations/backgrounds (no-code) | unicorn.studio |
| **Iconify** | 200k+ open-source icons (one-line JS) | iconify.design |
| **Solar Icons** | Premium icon set (outline, broken, duotone) | Part of Iconify |
| **Simple Icons** | Brand logos (SVG, monotone) | simpleicons.org |
| **Screen Studio** | Mac screen recorder (premium) | screen.studio |

### Inspiration Resources
| Resource | Purpose | URL |
|----------|---------|-----|
| **Superhero** | Hero section inspiration | superhero.so |
| **Bento Grids** | Card/bento layout examples | bentogrids.com |
| **Mobin** | Full website sections & animations | mobin.io |
| **Dribbble** | Design inspiration (features, layouts) | dribbble.com |
| **H1 Gallery** | Headlines & hooks inspiration | h1.gallery |
| **CTA Gallery** | Call-to-action section examples | cta.gallery |

### Typography (Google Fonts â€” Free)
| Font | Style | Use Case |
|------|-------|----------|
| **Newsreader** | Serif + beautiful italic | Headlines, editorial |
| **Inter** | Sans-serif (most popular worldwide) | Body, clean UI |
| **Playfair Display** | Serif, elegant | Headlines, luxury |
| *Tip:* Pair serif + sans-serif for premium feel |

---

## ðŸŽ¨ KEY ANIMATION TECHNIQUES

### Prompt Arsenal (for AI template generation)
```
1. "Create a hero section" â€” Start here, spend 50% of time
2. "Add beam animation" â€” 1px continuously around button shape
3. "Add marquee animation" â€” For logos, scrolling elements
4. "Add noodles to connect with circle" â€” Decorative lines
5. "Beam animate the noodles" â€” Animated connecting lines
6. "Add vertical container size lines" â€” Grid detail lines
7. "Use 01, 02, 03 steps" â€” Numbered sections detail
8. "Fade in, blur in, slide in animation" â€” Section transitions
9. "Add sticky element + steps" â€” Scroll storytelling
10. "Change to [color], dark/light mode" â€” Quick theme changes
11. "Adapt new section" â€” Reference screenshot to generate
12. "Use Iconify Solar / Simple Icons" â€” Professional icon sets
```

### Animation Types to Master
- **Beam animations** â€” Light effect around buttons/elements
- **Marquee animations** â€” Logo scrollers, text tickers
- **Circle/sonar animations** â€” Pulsing elements
- **Scroll-triggered** â€” Text completion, sticky elements
- **Hover effects** â€” Button glow, card lift
- **WebGL backgrounds** â€” Via Unicorn Studio

---

## ðŸ’¡ BUSINESS IDEAS FOR PULSE GRAPHIX

### Idea 1: Template Store (Passive Income) â­â­â­â­â­
**Revenue potential:** â‚¬5,000 - â‚¬25,000/month

**Strategy:**
1. Create 5-10 premium animated landing page templates
2. Sell on Framer (100% earnings) + Webflow (95% earnings)
3. Price: â‚¬49-â‚¬99 per template
4. Target niches: SaaS, Restaurant, Agency, Portfolio, E-commerce
5. Use AI (Gemini 3 / Claude) to produce at 10x speed

**Why Pulse Graphix wins:**
- Kabundji has 21 years design experience = taste advantage
- Already has branding skills for premium aesthetics
- Can create French + English versions (wider market)
- AI-powered production = faster than competitors

### Idea 2: "Website-in-a-Day" Premium Service â­â­â­â­
**Revenue potential:** â‚¬2,000 - â‚¬5,000 per project

**Strategy:**
1. Use AI to generate stunning landing pages in hours
2. Add Unicorn Studio backgrounds + custom animations
3. Deliver in 24-48h what used to take 2 weeks
4. Premium positioning: "Agency-quality at freelancer prices"
5. Target: SMBs in Paris + remote clients

### Idea 3: Template Remix Service â­â­â­â­
**Revenue potential:** â‚¬500 - â‚¬1,500 per remix

**Strategy:**
1. Take existing templates, customize for specific businesses
2. Change language (FR/EN), colors, branding, content
3. Deploy on client's hosting
4. Quick turnaround (same-day possible with AI)
5. Perfect for the Torcy boulangerie prospects!

### Idea 4: Design Course / YouTube Channel â­â­â­
**Revenue potential:** â‚¬1,000 - â‚¬5,000/month (long term)

**Strategy:**
1. Document template creation process on YouTube
2. Share tips, prompts, and techniques in French market
3. Very few French creators doing this = blue ocean
4. Monetize via ads, affiliate links, template sales

### Idea 5: White-Label Template Agency â­â­â­â­
**Revenue potential:** â‚¬3,000 - â‚¬10,000/month

**Strategy:**
1. Create templates for other agencies to resell
2. Bulk pricing: 10 templates = â‚¬2,000
3. Agencies add their branding and sell to end clients
4. Recurring revenue from template updates

---

## ðŸ”§ SKILLS & TOOLS FOR CLAUDE CODE / OPENCLAW

### Already Available (Installed)
| Skill | Purpose |
|-------|---------|
| âœ… **frontend-design** | Expert UI/landing page generation |
| âœ… **designer** | Logo, visual systems, branding |
| âœ… **shadcn-ui** | Component library integration |
| âœ… **color-palette** | WCAG-compliant color systems |
| âœ… **happy-hues** | Curated palettes for design |
| âœ… **openai-image-gen** | AI image generation for assets |

### Can Be Built / Added
| Skill Needed | Purpose | Priority |
|-------------|---------|----------|
| ðŸ”¨ **template-generator** | Automated landing page creation from prompts | HIGH |
| ðŸ”¨ **animation-library** | CSS animation presets (beam, marquee, fade) | HIGH |
| ðŸ”¨ **icon-integration** | Iconify/Solar icon embedding | MEDIUM |
| ðŸ”¨ **template-publisher** | Auto-deploy to Framer/Webflow | MEDIUM |
| ðŸ”¨ **screenshot-to-html** | Reference image â†’ code conversion | LOW (Gemini better) |

### AI Model Recommendations for Templates
| Task | Best Model | Why |
|------|-----------|-----|
| UI Generation | **Gemini 3** | Best at visual design/HTML |
| Code Editing | **Claude Opus 4.5** | Best at code quality |
| Fast Small Edits | **GPT 5.1** | Fastest response time |
| Image Assets | **Nano Banana Pro** | Best for mockups, 3D |

---

## ðŸ“… ACTION PLAN

### Phase 1: Foundation (Week 1-2)
- [ ] Set up Aura account ($20/mo) â€” explore templates
- [ ] Set up Unicorn Studio account â€” learn WebGL backgrounds
- [ ] Bookmark all inspiration resources (Superhero, Mobin, etc.)
- [ ] Create first 3 landing page templates using AI
- [ ] Build CSS animation library (beam, marquee, fade, scroll)

### Phase 2: Portfolio (Week 3-4)
- [ ] Create 5 premium templates for different niches
- [ ] Add Unicorn Studio backgrounds to hero sections
- [ ] Set up Framer Creator account
- [ ] Set up Webflow Template marketplace account
- [ ] Deploy templates for review

### Phase 3: Launch (Month 2)
- [ ] List first 5 templates on Framer ($79-$99 each)
- [ ] List on Webflow marketplace
- [ ] Create social media covers (the Aura canvas technique)
- [ ] Start posting on Twitter/Instagram (1 template showcase/week)
- [ ] LinkedIn posts about the AI design workflow

### Phase 4: Scale (Month 3+)
- [ ] Produce 5-10 templates per week using AI
- [ ] Build email list from free template downloads
- [ ] Create YouTube tutorials (French market â€” blue ocean!)
- [ ] Offer "Website-in-a-Day" premium service
- [ ] Train Alex Prime to auto-generate template starting points

---

## ðŸ”‘ KEY INSIGHTS (Most Important)

1. **50% of time should go to the hero section** â€” it's the cover image that drives social media engagement
2. **Screenshots > prompts** â€” Taking a screenshot of inspiration and feeding it to AI is faster than writing 1000 words
3. **Negative prompts matter** â€” "Don't change anything else" prevents AI from breaking existing sections
4. **Edit mode vs Generate mode** â€” Use edit mode for small changes, generate mode for new sections
5. **Icon sets differentiate** â€” Using Solar/custom icons instead of default Lucide avoids "AI slop" look
6. **Font pairing is crucial** â€” Serif + Sans-serif (e.g., Newsreader + Inter) = premium feel
7. **Color alternation** â€” Don't make entire page one color, alternate backgrounds
8. **Framer = 100% earnings** â€” Best marketplace for template income
9. **French market is UNDERSERVED** â€” Very few French AI template creators
10. **Templates can be localized** â€” AI can translate/adapt to any language instantly

---

## ðŸ’° REVENUE PROJECTIONS

### Conservative Estimate (6 months)
| Stream | Monthly Revenue |
|--------|----------------|
| Template sales (10 templates Ã— 5 sales/mo Ã— â‚¬79) | â‚¬3,950 |
| Client work (2 projects Ã— â‚¬1,500) | â‚¬3,000 |
| Template remixes (4 Ã— â‚¬800) | â‚¬3,200 |
| **TOTAL** | **â‚¬10,150/mo** |

### Optimistic Estimate (12 months)
| Stream | Monthly Revenue |
|--------|----------------|
| Template sales (30 templates Ã— 10 sales/mo Ã— â‚¬79) | â‚¬23,700 |
| Client work (3 projects Ã— â‚¬2,500) | â‚¬7,500 |
| YouTube/Course revenue | â‚¬2,000 |
| **TOTAL** | **â‚¬33,200/mo** |

---

*This document is the strategic foundation for Pulse Graphix's template business.*
*Created by Alex Prime | Feb 13, 2026*

# Agent Zero (A0) â€” Analysis & Comparison
## What It Is, What We Can Learn, How It Compares to OpenClaw

**Researched:** February 14, 2026  
**By:** Alex Prime  
**Sources:** agent-zero.ai, GitHub (agent0ai/agent-zero), project paper  
**Purpose:** Reference document for improving our agent architecture

---

## 1. What Is Agent Zero?

Agent Zero is an **open-source autonomous AI agent framework** created by Jan TomÃ¡Å¡ek (March 2024). It runs inside a **self-contained Docker Linux environment** â€” essentially an AI with its own virtual computer.

**Website:** https://www.agent-zero.ai  
**GitHub:** https://github.com/agent0ai/agent-zero  
**License:** Open source  
**Mentioned in:** Linux Foundation's Decentralization and AI paper

### Core Philosophy
> "A personal, organic agentic framework that grows and learns with you"

Not a pre-programmed chatbot â€” it's designed to be **dynamic, self-learning, and self-improving**. The AI can create its own tools, install its own software, and adapt to new tasks without being explicitly programmed for them.

---

## 2. Architecture

### How It Works
```

â”‚  â”‚  â”‚   Agent Zero (Python)   â”‚  â”‚  â”‚
â”‚  â”‚  â”‚  â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â” â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â” â”‚  â”‚  â”‚
â”‚  â”‚  â”‚  â”‚ LLM   â”‚ â”‚ Memory  â”‚ â”‚  â”‚  â”‚

â”‚  â”‚  â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”  â”‚  â”‚
â”‚  â”‚  â”‚ SearXNG (Private Search)â”‚  â”‚  â”‚
â”‚  â”‚  â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜  â”‚  â”‚
â”‚  â”‚  â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”  â”‚  â”‚
â”‚  â”‚  â”‚ Web UI (Port 50001)    â”‚  â”‚  â”‚
â”‚  â”‚  â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜  â”‚  â”‚
â”‚  â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜  â”‚
â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜
```

### Key Components

| Component | Description |
|-----------|-------------|
| **Docker Container** | Full Linux environment, isolated from host |
| **LLM Integration** | OpenAI, Anthropic, Grok, OpenRouter, GitHub Copilot, Ollama (local) |
| **FAISS Vector Memory** | Hybrid memory with categories: facts, solutions, instruments |
| **SearXNG** | Self-hosted, privacy-respecting search engine |
| **Browser** | Integrated browser via browser-use (like OpenAI Operator) |
| **Web UI** | Clean, real-time streaming interface on port 50001 |
| **Code Execution** | Python, Node.js, Bash â€” anything installable |
| **Speech** | TTS + STT (local Whisper model) |

---

## 3. Key Features & Strengths

### ðŸŸ¢ Strengths (What Agent Zero Does Well)

**1. Full OS Access**
- Runs inside its own Linux OS (Docker)
- Can install packages, run scripts, manage files
- Complete isolation from host = safe experimentation
- Standardized environment that works the same everywhere

**2. Self-Creating Tools**
- No pre-programmed tool limitations
- Agent writes its own tools on the fly
- Stores successful tools in memory for reuse ("Instruments")
- This is a massive differentiator

**3. Hybrid Memory System (FAISS)**
- Vector-based semantic search (not just keyword)
- Memory categories:
  - **Main memories** â€” core facts and instructions
  - **Conversation fragments** â€” relevant past conversations
  - **Proven solutions** â€” code/approaches that worked before
  - **Custom instruments** â€” tools the agent created
- Dynamic context compression â€” keeps conversations coherent even when long
- Memory Dashboard â€” UI to browse, search, edit, delete memories

**4. Multi-Agent Cooperation**
- Hierarchical: every agent has a superior (human or another agent)
- Agents spawn subordinates for subtasks
- Each subordinate reports back to its superior
- Keeps each agent's context clean and focused
- Similar to our Subagent Pyramid but built-in

**5. Fully Customizable**
- Nothing is hard-coded
- All behavior defined by system prompts in `prompts/` folder
- All tools in `python/tools/` â€” modifiable or replaceable
- Extensions system (Python) for deep behavior hooks
- The framework doesn't constrain the agent at all

**6. Skills System (SKILL.md Standard)**
- Uses the same SKILL.md standard as Claude Code, Cursor, Codex
- Portable, structured agent capabilities
- Compatible across platforms

**7. Project Isolation**
- Separate projects with dedicated agents, memory, and credentials
- Prevents context bleed across different work
- Great for multi-client agencies like Pulse Graphix

**8. A2A Protocol**
- Agent-to-Agent communication
- Multiple Agent Zero instances can collaborate
- FastA2A protocol for inter-agent messaging

**9. MCP Integration**
- Model Context Protocol support
- Acts as both MCP client AND server
- Tool interoperability with external systems

**10. Privacy-First**
- SearXNG = no tracking, no corporate search dependencies
- Self-hosted = data stays on your machine
- Docker = isolated from host system

### ðŸ”´ Weaknesses / Limitations

**1. Resource Heavy**
- Full Docker container with Linux OS
- Requires decent server specs
- Higher costs than lightweight agents

**2. Setup Complexity**
- More complex than plug-and-play solutions
- Docker knowledge required
- Configuration through environment variables

**3. Security Risks**
- Full OS access = potentially dangerous
- Agent can run any command on its container
- Requires careful sandboxing and monitoring
- Their own docs warn: "Agent Zero Can Be Dangerous!"

**4. No Native Mobile/Messaging Integration**
- Web UI only (no Telegram, WhatsApp, Discord built-in)
- Would need custom integration for messaging platforms
- OpenClaw handles this natively

**5. Token-Heavy Memory System**
- FAISS vector search is powerful but memory retrieval can be token-expensive
- Dynamic context compression may lose nuance

**6. Crypto Token (A0T)**
- Governance via crypto token â€” adds complexity
- Token value volatile, community governance untested at scale

---

## 4. Comparison: Agent Zero vs OpenClaw

| Feature | Agent Zero | OpenClaw (Alex Prime) |
|---------|-----------|----------------------|
| **Environment** | Full Docker Linux OS | Host OS (VPS/bare metal) |
| **Isolation** | Container sandbox | Process-level |
| **Memory** | FAISS vector + categories | File-based + memory_search |
| **Search** | SearXNG (self-hosted) | Brave API |
| **Browser** | browser-use integration | Playwright-based |
| **Multi-Agent** | Built-in hierarchical | Sub-agent spawning |
| **Messaging** | Web UI only | Telegram, WhatsApp, Discord, Signal, etc. |
| **Voice** | TTS + STT (Whisper) | TTS (ElevenLabs/OpenAI) |
| **Tools** | Self-creating (dynamic) | Skill-based (SKILL.md) |
| **Customization** | Prompt files + extensions | AGENTS.md + SOUL.md + config |
| **Skills** | SKILL.md standard | SKILL.md standard (same!) |
| **Projects** | Isolated workspaces | Single workspace |
| **Model Support** | Multi-provider | Multi-provider (OpenRouter) |
| **Cron/Scheduling** | Not built-in | Native cron system |
| **Heartbeats** | Not built-in | Native heartbeat system |
| **Setup** | Docker pull + run | npm install + config |
| **Cost** | Open source (free) | Open source (free) |
| **Community** | GitHub + token governance | Discord |

### Where Agent Zero Wins
1. **Full OS isolation** â€” safer for dangerous operations
2. **Self-creating tools** â€” no pre-programming needed
3. **Project isolation** â€” multi-client work without context bleed
4. **Memory Dashboard** â€” visual memory management UI
5. **A2A Protocol** â€” standardized inter-agent communication

### Where OpenClaw Wins
1. **Native messaging** â€” Telegram, WhatsApp, Discord, Signal built-in
2. **Heartbeat system** â€” proactive, scheduled check-ins
3. **Cron jobs** â€” precise scheduling and reminders
4. **Lighter footprint** â€” no Docker overhead
5. **Channel routing** â€” seamless multi-platform communication
6. **Session management** â€” main + isolated sessions with spawning

---

## 5. Ideas to Steal / Implement

### ðŸ”¥ HIGH PRIORITY â€” Implement Now

**1. Tiered Memory Categories (from FAISS system)**
- Currently: flat file-based memory
- Implement: Categorize memories into facts, solutions, lessons, instruments
- How: Already started with `docs/CONTEXT-MEMORY-SYSTEM.md` (3-tier architecture)

**2. Project Isolation**
- Currently: single workspace for everything
- Implement: Separate directories per client with isolated context
- How: `projects/pulse-graphix/`, `projects/client-2/`, etc.
- Each with own memory, TODO, and context files

**3. Dynamic Context Compression**
- Currently: OpenClaw handles compaction automatically
- Improve: Pre-compress context before it hits limits
- How: Follow CONTEXT-MEMORY-SYSTEM.md protocols

### ðŸŸ¡ MEDIUM PRIORITY â€” Implement When Needed

**4. Instruments (Reusable Tool Recipes)**
- Agent Zero stores successful tool combinations for reuse
- We could create `instruments/` folder with proven workflows
- Example: "prospect research" instrument with exact steps

**5. Memory Dashboard**
- Visual UI for browsing/editing agent memories
- Could add to our Next.js dashboard
- Browse, search, edit MEMORY.md and daily files

**6. A2A Protocol**
- When we deploy the Subagent Pyramid, use standardized communication
- Agent-to-agent messaging format
- Already partially done with sessions_send

### ðŸŸ¢ LOW PRIORITY â€” Nice to Have

**7. Self-Hosted Search (SearXNG)**
- Privacy-respecting, no rate limits
- Would eliminate Brave API rate limiting issues
- Docker: `docker pull searxng/searxng`

**8. Local LLM Support (Ollama)**
- For cost reduction on simple tasks
- Run small models locally for classification/routing
- Ollama: `docker pull ollama/ollama`

---

## 6. Key Takeaways

1. **Agent Zero and OpenClaw are complementary** â€” A0 excels at isolated computing tasks, OpenClaw excels at communication and integration
2. **Memory management is the #1 differentiator** â€” A0's FAISS system is more sophisticated than our file-based approach, but ours is more transparent and debuggable
3. **Self-creating tools is revolutionary** â€” This is the biggest idea worth studying. Agents that build their own tools grow exponentially
4. **Project isolation prevents context bleed** â€” Critical for multi-client work (Pulse Graphix + future clients)
5. **The SKILL.md standard is shared** â€” Both platforms use it, meaning skills are portable between A0 and OpenClaw
6. **Docker isolation is the gold standard** for security â€” Something to consider for risky operations

---

## 7. Recommendation for Our System

**Short-term (now):**
- Implement the 3-tier memory system (CONTEXT-MEMORY-SYSTEM.md) âœ…
- Start categorizing memories (facts vs solutions vs lessons)
- Create project directories for client isolation

**Medium-term (1-2 months):**
- Build instruments system (reusable workflow recipes)
- Add memory management section to dashboard
- Consider SearXNG Docker for unlimited private search

**Long-term (3-6 months):**
- Evaluate running Agent Zero alongside OpenClaw for compute-heavy tasks
- Agent Zero for: code generation, data processing, server management
- OpenClaw for: communication, scheduling, client interaction
- Both sharing the same SKILL.md skills

---

*This document is a living reference. Update as Agent Zero evolves and as we implement features.*

# Claude Opus 4.6 Upgrade Plan
## Upgrading Alex Prime's Brain to the Latest Model

*Created: February 6, 2026*
*Author: Alex Prime*

---

## ðŸ§  What's New in Claude Opus 4.6

**Released:** February 5, 2026 (yesterday!)

### Key Improvements:

| Feature | Description |
|---------|-------------|
| **1 Million Token Context** | 4x larger than previous (was 256K) â€” can handle entire codebases |
| **Agent Teams** | Multiple agents working in parallel on different parts of a task |
| **Better Coding** | Improved software development capabilities |
| **PowerPoint Integration** | Direct integration with Microsoft Office |
| **Enterprise Focus** | Designed for knowledge workers, not just developers |

### Pricing (Unchanged):
- **Input:** $5 per 1 million tokens
- **Output:** $25 per 1 million tokens
- **Extended context (>200K):** $10/$37.50 per million tokens

---

## ðŸŽ¯ Why Upgrade?

### Benefits for Alex Prime:

1. **Longer Memory per Session**
   - 1M tokens = ~750,000 words of context
   - Can read entire projects without forgetting earlier parts

2. **Agent Teams Feature**
   - Can spawn sub-agents that work in parallel
   - Faster completion of complex tasks
   - Better overnight work capability

3. **Better Coding**
   - Improved code generation
   - Better understanding of large codebases
   - More accurate debugging

4. **Same Price**
   - No cost increase from Opus 4.5
   - Same $20/month Anthropic plan works

---

## ðŸ“Š Plan Options

### Option A: Stay on Current Plan ($20/month)
- âœ… Get Opus 4.6 automatically (just model name change)
- âœ… No action needed from you
- âš ï¸ Limited usage (same token limits)

### Option B: Upgrade to Max Plan ($100/month)
- âœ… 5x more usage
- âœ… Priority access to new features
- âœ… Agent teams preview access
- âœ… Better for heavy overnight work
- âš ï¸ Higher cost

### Option C: API Direct ($5/$25 per million tokens)
- âœ… Pay only for what you use
- âœ… No monthly cap
- âœ… Full access to all features
- âš ï¸ Can get expensive with heavy use
- âš ï¸ Need to manage billing

---

## ðŸ› ï¸ How to Upgrade

### Step 1: Update OpenClaw (if needed)
```bash
curl -fsSL https://openclaw.ai/install.sh | bash -s -- --no-onboard
```

### Step 2: Change Model in Config

**Option A â€” Via OpenClaw CLI:**
```bash
# View current config
openclaw gateway config.get

# The model should auto-update if using "anthropic/claude-opus-4"
# If pinned to specific version, update manually
```

**Option B â€” Edit Config Directly:**
```bash
nano ~/.openclaw/openclaw.json
```

Find the models section and change:
```json
"default": "anthropic/claude-opus-4-6"
```

### Step 3: Restart Gateway
```bash
openclaw gateway restart
```

### Step 4: Verify
```bash
openclaw status
# Should show: model=anthropic/claude-opus-4-6
```

---

## ðŸ’° Cost Comparison

| Plan | Monthly Cost | Best For |
|------|--------------|----------|
| Current (Anthropic $20) | $20 | Light usage, testing |
| Max Plan | $100 | Heavy daily use, overnight work |
| API Direct | Variable (~$50-200) | Predictable heavy workloads |

### Estimated Usage (Alex Prime):
- ~500K tokens/day average
- ~15M tokens/month
- **API cost:** ~$75-100/month (input) + ~$375-500/month (output)
- **Recommendation:** Max Plan ($100) is better value for consistent use

---

## ðŸš€ Upgrade Steps Summary

1. **Immediate (Free):**
   - Update OpenClaw to get Opus 4.6 support
   - Model may auto-switch or need config change

2. **If Upgrading Plan:**
   - Go to: https://console.anthropic.com
   - Upgrade to Max plan
   - Update API key if needed

3. **After Upgrade:**
   - Test with complex task
   - Monitor token usage
   - Verify agent teams work (if on API/Max)

---

## âš ï¸ Important Notes

- Opus 4.6 is **backward compatible** â€” all existing prompts work
- Agent teams requires API access or Max plan (preview)
- 1M context is opt-in (uses more tokens = more cost)
- Your personality files (SOUL.md, etc.) are NOT affected

---

## ðŸ”® Recommendation

**For Kabundji's Use Case:**

Given that you want Alex Prime to:
- Work overnight autonomously
- Handle complex multi-step tasks
- Be more productive

**Recommended:** Upgrade to **Max Plan ($100/month)** when ready.

This gives:
- Full Opus 4.6 access
- Agent teams preview
- 5x usage headroom
- Priority support

**Timeline:**
1. Week 1: Test Opus 4.6 on current plan
2. Week 2: Evaluate if usage hits limits
3. Week 3: Upgrade to Max if needed

---

*Questions? Ask Alex Prime or check https://docs.anthropic.com*

# Cloud Storage Services Comparison
*For Kabundji â€” February 14, 2026*

## Your Use Case Summary
- **Need**: Backup workspace files, documents, templates
- **Location**: Remote VPS/workspace
- **Priority**: Reliable backup, easy integration for me (AI agent)
- **Ideal**: Large space at low cost, API/CLI access for automation

---

## TOP RECOMMENDATIONS â­

### 1. Google Drive â­ BEST OVERALL
| Feature | Details |
|---------|---------|
| **Free Storage** | 15 GB (shared with Gmail, Photos) |
| **Paid Plans** | 100 GB: $1.67/mo â†’ 2 TB: $9.99/mo |
| **Max Storage** | 30 TB |
| **API Access** | âœ… Excellent (Google Drive API) |
| **CLI Tools** | âœ… rclone, drive CLI |
| **Sync** | Web, Desktop, Mobile |

**Pros:**
- âœ… **Best integration with OpenClaw** â€” likely already supported
- âœ… Most generous free tier (15 GB)
- âœ… API access for automation
- âœ… Fast sync (1 Gbps speeds)
- âœ… Built-in Docs/Sheets/Slides for quick editing
- âœ… 5 TB file size limit

**Cons:**
- âŒ Privacy concerns (Google scans files)
- âŒ Shared quota with Gmail

**Price Examples (yearly = 16% discount):**
- 100 GB: $19.99/year ($1.67/mo)
- 2 TB: $99.99/year ($8.33/mo)
- 5 TB: $249.99/year

**Verdict**: **RECOMMENDED** â€” Best value, easy API, generous free storage

---

### 2. IDrive â­ BEST FOR BACKUP
| Feature | Details |
|---------|---------|
| **Free Storage** | 10 GB |
| **Paid Plans** | **5 TB: $24.88 first year** â†’ then $69.95/year |
| **Max Storage** | 50 TB+ (plans scale) |
| **API Access** | âœ… Yes (REST API) |
| **CLI Tools** | âœ… Linux/Windows/Mac CLI |
| **Backup Type** | Continuous, block-level sync |

**Pros:**
- âœ… **CHEAPEST storage per TB** by far
- âœ… Can backup to physical drives they send you
- âœ… Can backup AWS, Dropbox, Google Drive (clone other clouds!)
- âœ… Continuous backup (changes sync instantly)
- âœ… Linux/Windows/Mac CLI available

**Cons:**
- âŒ Not as user-friendly as Google Drive
- âŒ Sharing not as seamless

**Pricing (Annual â€” 50% off first year):**
| Plan | First Year | Regular | Per TB/Year |
|------|------------|---------|-------------|
| Mini (100 GB) | $3.71 | $9.95 | ~$100 |
| Personal (5 TB) | **$24.88** | $69.95 | **$14/TB** |
| Personal (10 TB) | $49.88 | $99.95 | **$10/TB** |

**Verdict**: **BEST VALUE FOR PURE BACKUP** â€” 5TB for $25 first year

---

### 3. Dropbox â€” Best for Collaboration
| Feature | Details |
|---------|---------|
| **Free Storage** | 2 GB (worst free tier) |
| **Paid Plans** | 2 TB: $10/mo â†’ 3 TB: $17/mo |
| **API Access** | âœ… Yes |
| **CLI Tools** | âœ… Yes |
| **Unique** | Block-level sync, eSignatures |

**Pros:**
- âœ… Block-level sync (only changed chunks synced)
- âœ… Best third-party integrations
- âœ… eSignatures built-in
- âœ… Fast sync

**Cons:**
- âŒ Expensive ($10/mo for 2TB vs $25 first year for 5TB with IDrive)
- âŒ Free tier only 2 GB
- âŒ Security breaches in past

**Pricing:**
- Plus (2 TB): $9.99/mo or $119.88/year
- Family (2 TB, 6 users): $16.99/mo

**Verdict**: Good for collaboration, but **overpriced** for pure storage

---

### 4. Microsoft OneDrive â€” Good for Office Users
| Feature | Details |
|---------|---------|
| **Free Storage** | 5 GB |
| **Paid Plans** | 100 GB: $1.67/mo â†’ 6 TB: $8.33/mo |
| **API Access** | âœ… Yes |
| **CLI Tools** | âœ… Via rclone |
| **Unique** | Personal Vault, Office Online |

**Pros:**
- âœ… Good value (6 TB for $8.33/mo)
- âœ… Personal Vault (secure file storage)
- âœ… Block-level sync
- âœ… Built-in Office apps

**Cons:**
- âŒ Works best with Windows
- âŒ Smaller ecosystem than Google Drive

**Pricing:**
- 100 GB: $1.99/mo
- Microsoft 365 (1 TB): $6.99/mo (includes Office apps)
- Family (6 TB across 6 users): $9.99/mo

**Verdict**: Good if already using Microsoft 365

---

## QUICK COMPARISON TABLE

| Service | Free | 2 TB Cost | 5 TB Cost | API | Best For |
|---------|------|-----------|-----------|-----|----------|
| **Google Drive** | 15 GB | $8.33/mo | â€” | âœ… | General use, productivity |
| **IDrive** | 10 GB | â€” | $24.88/yr (1st yr) | âœ… | **Cheapest backup** |
| **Dropbox** | 2 GB | $10/mo | $17+/mo | âœ… | Collaboration, sync |
| **OneDrive** | 5 GB | Included in M365 | $8.33/mo | âœ… | Office integration |
| **pCloud** | 10 GB | $9.99/mo | â€” | âœ… | Lifetime plans |
| **Sync.com** | 5 GB | $8/mo | â€” | âœ… | **Privacy** |

---

## RECOMMENDATION FOR YOUR USE CASE

### Option A: Budget-Focused â†’ **IDrive**
- **5 TB for $24.88 first year** ($69.95/year after)
- Perfect for automated backups of workspace
- Can backup entire VPS/image disks
- CLI tools for automation

### Option B: Balanced â†’ **Google Drive**
- Start with free 15 GB
- Upgrade to 2 TB: $99.99/year
- Best API/integration with my tools
- Can access files anywhere, edit in Docs

### Option C: Privacy-Focused â†’ **Sync.com**
- Client-side encryption
- 5 GB free
- 2 TB: $8/month
- Zero-knowledge (even they can't read your files)

---

## FOR AI AGENT (MY) WORKFLOW

**What I Need:**
1. A folder/directory in cloud storage
2. API key or connection method
3. Automation to sync key files

**Best Setup:**
```
Workspace â†’ (rsync/rclone) â†’ Google Drive OR IDrive
```

**What to Back Up:**
- `/workspace/templates/*` â€” Your templates
- `/workspace/prospects/*` â€” Prospect research
- `/workspace/business/*` â€” Strategy documents
- `/workspace/memory/*.md` â€” Daily logs
- `/workspace/dashboard/*` â€” Dashboard files

---

## NEXT STEPS

1. **Pick a service** from above (I recommend IDrive or Google)
2. **Set up account** and share credentials/API key with me
3. **I'll configure** automated backup scripts
4. **I'll push** current workspace files to the cloud

**Want me to:**
- [ ] Create a backup script once you choose?
- [ ] Compare specific features in more detail?
- [ ] Research enterprise options (if needed)?

---

*Sources: Cloudwards.net 2026 review, IDrive pricing, CNET, PCMag, Zapier*
*Research completed: 2026-02-14*

files.name: CONTEXT-MEMORY-SYSTEM.md
files.content:
# ðŸ§  CONTEXT & MEMORY MANAGEMENT SYSTEM
## Alex Prime â€” Intelligent Context Management Protocol

**Created:** February 14, 2026  
**Author:** Alex Prime (designed with Opus 4.6 deep thinking)  
**Purpose:** Prevent context overflow, maintain accuracy, and ensure continuity across sessions  
**Status:** ACTIVE â€” Follow this protocol every session

---

## The Problem

Context windows have a hard limit. When conversations get long:
- Older messages get compressed or dropped
- Important details get lost in the noise
- Accuracy degrades as context fills with completed/irrelevant data
- Token costs increase unnecessarily
- Agent performance drops

## The Solution: 3-Tier Memory Architecture

### Tier 1: HOT MEMORY (Always in Context)
**Location:** Loaded every session via AGENTS.md directive  
**Max Size:** ~2,000 tokens combined  
**Contains:** Only what's needed RIGHT NOW

| File | Purpose | Max Size | Update Frequency |
|------|---------|----------|-----------------|
| `SOUL.md` | Identity & personality | 500 tokens | Rarely |
| `USER.md` | Who Kabundji is | 800 tokens | Monthly |
| `HEARTBEAT.md` | Current workflow rules | 500 tokens | As needed |
| `IDENTITY.md` | Agent identity | 200 tokens | Rarely |

**Rules:**
- Keep these files LEAN â€” every word costs tokens
- No completed tasks, no history, no archives
- Only active directives and current identity

### Tier 2: WARM MEMORY (Loaded on Demand)
**Location:** `MEMORY.md` + `memory/YYYY-MM-DD.md`  
**Max Size:** MEMORY.md â‰¤ 3,000 tokens; daily files â‰¤ 2,000 tokens each  
**Contains:** Recent context, active projects, key decisions

| File | Purpose | When to Load |
|------|---------|-------------|
| `MEMORY.md` | Curated long-term memory | Main sessions only |
| `memory/today.md` | Today's activity log | Every session |
| `memory/yesterday.md` | Yesterday's context | If needed for continuity |
| `TODO.md` | Active task tracker | On heartbeats |

**Rules:**
- MEMORY.md is curated â€” NOT a dump of everything
- Use `memory_search` to find specific info instead of loading entire files
- Daily files get archived after 7 days (see Tier 3)

### Tier 3: COLD MEMORY (Searchable Archive)
**Location:** `memory/archive/` + `docs/` + `business/`  
**Max Size:** Unlimited (stored on disk)  
**Contains:** Completed work, historical decisions, reference documents

| Location | Contents |
|----------|----------|
| `memory/archive/YYYY-MM.md` | Monthly summaries (compressed from daily files) |
| `memory/archive/decisions.md` | Key decisions log with dates and reasoning |
| `memory/archive/lessons.md` | Lessons learned (mistakes, insights) |
| `docs/` | Reference documents, guides, research |
| `business/` | Business documents, briefs, strategies |
| `social-media/` | Strategy documents |
| `prospects/` | Lead research |
| `templates/` | Design templates |

**Rules:**
- Never load cold memory into context unless specifically needed
- Use `memory_search` to find relevant snippets
- Summarize before loading â€” never dump raw files into context

---

## Context Budget Protocol

### Per-Session Token Budget (Target)

```
CATEGORY              | MAX TOKENS | NOTES
â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”¼â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”¼â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€
System Prompt         |   ~3,000   | OpenClaw injects this
Hot Memory (Tier 1)   |   ~2,000   | SOUL + USER + HEARTBEAT + IDENTITY
Warm Memory (Tier 2)  |   ~3,000   | MEMORY.md (only in main sessions)
Conversation History  |  ~50,000   | Managed by OpenClaw compaction
Working Space         |  ~40,000   | For actual task work
â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”¼â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”¼â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€
TOTAL AVAILABLE       | ~100,000   | Varies by model
```

### Rules for Staying Within Budget

1. **Write to files, not inline** â€” If output > 500 tokens, write to a file and summarize
2. **Don't repeat context** â€” If info is in a file, reference it, don't paste it
3. **Compress completed work** â€” Move done tasks from TODO.md to archive
4. **Use memory_search** â€” Search before loading entire files
5. **Batch tool outputs** â€” Process results, don't echo them verbatim
6. **Summarize sub-agent results** â€” Don't paste full transcripts

---

## Daily Memory Maintenance Protocol

### Every Morning (First Heartbeat After 06:00 UTC)
1. Archive yesterday's daily file if > 2,000 tokens:
   - Summarize key events into 500-token version
   - Move original to `memory/archive/raw/YYYY-MM-DD.md`
   - Keep summary as `memory/YYYY-MM-DD.md`
2. Review MEMORY.md â€” remove anything no longer relevant
3. Create today's daily file: `memory/YYYY-MM-DD.md`

### Weekly (Every Monday)
1. Compress last 7 daily files into weekly summary
2. Update `memory/archive/YYYY-WNN.md` (week number)
3. Review and trim MEMORY.md:
   - Remove completed project details (keep only lessons)
   - Update active project status
   - Remove outdated credentials/links
4. Clean TODO.md â€” move completed items to archive

### Monthly (First Monday of Month)
1. Create monthly summary: `memory/archive/YYYY-MM.md`
2. Review all warm memory files for relevance
3. Update `memory/archive/decisions.md` with month's key decisions
4. Update `memory/archive/lessons.md` with new insights
5. Audit MEMORY.md â€” should be < 3,000 tokens

---

## MEMORY.md Structure (Keep This Lean!)

```markdown
# MEMORY.md â€” Alex Prime Long-Term Memory
*Last Updated: YYYY-MM-DD*

## ðŸ”¥ ACTIVE RIGHT NOW (remove when done)
- Current project: [name] â€” [1-line status]
- Blocked on: [what]
- Next action: [what]

## ðŸ‘¤ Key Context
- [Only things that affect EVERY interaction]
- [Kabundji preferences that matter daily]

## ðŸ¢ Business Quick Reference
- [Company name, key URLs, pricing summary]
- [NOT full briefs â€” those live in business/ folder]

## ðŸ”‘ Credentials & Access
- [Active credentials only]
- [Remove expired/unused]

## ðŸ“ Lessons Learned
- [Only lessons that prevent repeated mistakes]
- [Max 10 items â€” archive the rest]

## ðŸ”— Key File Locations
- [Map of where important files live]
- [So we can find them without loading everything]
```

**Target:** MEMORY.md should be readable in 30 seconds. If it takes longer, it's too long.

---

## Smart Context Loading Rules

### Session Start Checklist
```
1. Read SOUL.md âœ“ (always)
2. Read USER.md âœ“ (always)
3. Read HEARTBEAT.md âœ“ (always)
4. Read IDENTITY.md âœ“ (always)
5. IF main session â†’ Read MEMORY.md
6. IF heartbeat â†’ Read TODO.md
7. IF specific topic â†’ memory_search for relevant context
8. NEVER load more than 2 reference docs at once
```

### During Conversation
```
- Need old info? â†’ memory_search first, then memory_get specific lines
- Need a file's content? â†’ Read only relevant sections (use offset/limit)
- Creating output? â†’ Write to file if > 500 tokens
- Sub-agent result? â†’ Summarize in 2-3 sentences, reference file location
- Repeating yourself? â†’ Stop. Reference the file instead.
```

### Before Responding
```
- Is my response > 1,000 tokens? â†’ Consider writing to file
- Am I pasting file contents? â†’ Just reference the path
- Am I listing completed tasks? â†’ Summarize count, reference TODO.md
- Am I echoing tool output? â†’ Extract key info only
```

---

## Compaction-Friendly Practices

OpenClaw automatically compacts conversation history when context gets long. To make compaction work better:

1. **Front-load important info** â€” Key decisions at start of messages
2. **Use clear section headers** â€” Compaction preserves structure
3. **Don't spread one topic across many messages** â€” Consolidate
4. **Mark what matters** â€” Use ðŸ”¥ or âš ï¸ for critical items
5. **End messages with status** â€” "Status: X done, Y pending" helps recovery

---

## Emergency Context Recovery

If context gets corrupted or compacted too aggressively:

1. Read `MEMORY.md` â€” curated essentials
2. Read `TODO.md` â€” current task status
3. Read `memory/YYYY-MM-DD.md` (today) â€” what happened today
4. Run `memory_search` for specific topics
5. Check git log for recent commits: `git log --oneline -20`

This should reconstruct 90%+ of needed context in < 5,000 tokens.

---

## File Size Limits (Enforced)

| File | Max Lines | Max Tokens | Action When Exceeded |
|------|-----------|------------|---------------------|
| MEMORY.md | 150 | 3,000 | Archive old sections |
| TODO.md | 120 | 2,500 | Move completed to archive |
| HEARTBEAT.md | 50 | 1,000 | Keep only active rules |
| Daily memory | 100 | 2,000 | Summarize, archive raw |
| SOUL.md | 30 | 500 | Keep minimal |
| USER.md | 80 | 800 | Keep essential only |

---

## Implementation Checklist

- [ ] Create `memory/archive/` directory
- [ ] Create `memory/archive/decisions.md`
- [ ] Create `memory/archive/lessons.md`
- [ ] Trim MEMORY.md to < 150 lines
- [ ] Archive old daily memory files (> 7 days)
- [ ] Update AGENTS.md to reference this system
- [ ] Add weekly maintenance reminder to HEARTBEAT.md

---

*"The goal isn't to remember everything â€” it's to remember what matters and know where to find the rest."*

files.name: EMAIL_SETUP_GUIDE.md
files.content:
# ðŸ“§ EMAIL SETUP GUIDE
## Setting Up Gmail Access for Alex Prime

*Email: john.melo.testing01@gmail.com*

---

## Overview

We'll use **`gog` (Google CLI)** â€” a powerful tool that gives me access to:
- âœ‰ï¸ **Gmail** â€” Send, receive, search emails
- ðŸ“… **Calendar** â€” Manage events
- ðŸ“ **Drive** â€” Access files
- ðŸ“‡ **Contacts** â€” Manage contacts
- ðŸ“Š **Sheets** â€” Read/write spreadsheets
- ðŸ“„ **Docs** â€” Access documents

---

## Setup Steps

### Step 1: Install gog CLI

Run this command on the server:

```bash
# On Ubuntu/Linux
curl -fsSL https://gogcli.sh/install.sh | bash

# Or via npm
npm install -g gogcli
```

---

### Step 2: Create Google Cloud Project (One-time)

1. Go to: https://console.cloud.google.com/
2. Create a new project (name: "Alex Prime" or similar)
3. Enable these APIs:
   - Gmail API
   - Google Calendar API
   - Google Drive API
   - Google Contacts API
   - Google Sheets API
   - Google Docs API

---

### Step 3: Create OAuth Credentials

1. In Google Cloud Console â†’ **APIs & Services** â†’ **Credentials**
2. Click **Create Credentials** â†’ **OAuth client ID**
3. Application type: **Desktop app**
4. Name: "Alex Prime CLI"
5. Download the `client_secret_*.json` file

---

### Step 4: Configure gog with Credentials

Upload the `client_secret.json` to the server and run:

```bash
# Register the OAuth credentials
gog auth credentials /path/to/client_secret.json

# Add the Gmail account
gog auth add john.melo.testing01@gmail.com --services gmail,calendar,drive,contacts,docs,sheets
```

This will open a browser for OAuth consent. Complete the authorization.

---

### Step 5: Verify Setup

```bash
# List authorized accounts
gog auth list

# Test Gmail access
gog gmail search 'in:inbox' --max 5 --account john.melo.testing01@gmail.com
```

---

## What I Can Do Once Set Up

### ðŸ“§ Email Operations

```bash
# Send email
gog gmail send --to recipient@example.com \
  --subject "Meeting Request" \
  --body "Hello, I'd like to schedule a meeting..."

# Search emails
gog gmail search 'from:client@company.com newer_than:7d' --max 10

# Read specific email
gog gmail read <messageId>

# Reply to email
gog gmail send --to recipient@example.com \
  --subject "Re: Meeting" \
  --body "Thanks for your response..." \
  --reply-to-message-id <originalMsgId>

# Create draft (for review before sending)
gog gmail drafts create --to recipient@example.com \
  --subject "Proposal" \
  --body-file ./proposal.txt
```

### ðŸ“… Calendar Operations

```bash
# List upcoming events
gog calendar events primary --from 2026-01-31 --to 2026-02-07

# Create event
gog calendar create primary \
  --summary "Client Meeting" \
  --from "2026-02-01T10:00:00" \
  --to "2026-02-01T11:00:00"
```

### ðŸ“ Drive Operations

```bash
# Search files
gog drive search "project proposal" --max 10

# List files
gog drive list --max 20
```

---

## Alternative: Simple SMTP/IMAP (If OAuth is too complex)

If you prefer a simpler password-based approach:

### Enable Gmail App Password

1. Go to: https://myaccount.google.com/security
2. Enable **2-Step Verification**
3. Go to: https://myaccount.google.com/apppasswords
4. Create an App Password for "Mail" â†’ "Other (Custom name)" â†’ "Alex Prime"
5. Save the 16-character password

### Add to .env

```bash
# In .env file
GMAIL_USER=john.melo.testing01@gmail.com
GMAIL_APP_PASSWORD=xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx
```

### Use with himalaya (IMAP/SMTP CLI)

```bash
# Install himalaya
openclaw skills install himalaya

# Configure in ~/.config/himalaya/config.toml
```

---

## Recommended Approach

**For full functionality:** Use `gog` with OAuth
- Most secure
- Full API access
- No password storage

**For quick testing:** Use App Password + SMTP
- Simpler setup
- Limited features
- Password stored locally

---

## Security Notes

âš ï¸ **Important:**
- Never share OAuth credentials publicly
- Store App Passwords in `.env` (not in code)
- Use a dedicated email for agent operations (you're already doing this!)
- Review sent emails periodically

---

## Next Steps for Kabundji

1. **Create Google Cloud Project** (5 min)
   - https://console.cloud.google.com/

2. **Enable APIs** (2 min)
   - Gmail, Calendar, Drive, Contacts, Sheets, Docs

3. **Create OAuth Credentials** (3 min)
   - Download `client_secret.json`

4. **Share the `client_secret.json` with me** (upload to server)
   - I'll complete the setup

5. **Complete OAuth flow** (2 min)
   - One-time browser authorization

---

## Questions for You

1. **Do you want full Google Workspace access** (Gmail + Calendar + Drive)?
   Or just email?

2. **OAuth or App Password?**
   - OAuth = More secure, more features
   - App Password = Simpler, email only

3. **Can you access Google Cloud Console?**
   - If yes, we use OAuth
   - If not, we use App Password

---

*Guide ready. Let me know which approach you prefer and I'll walk you through it.*

**â€” Alex Prime ðŸŽ¯**

# Framer Marketplace Guide
**For Pulse Graphix Template Business**

---

## Overview
- **Revenue Split**: 100% to creator (Framer takes 0%)
- **Payout**: Via Stripe Connect
- **Review Time**: Up to 14 days
- **Affiliate Income**: Earn from free templates too

---

## Submission Requirements

### Design Quality
- Original design (no copying other templates)
- Consistent typography, spacing, colors
- Fully responsive (desktop, tablet, mobile)
- Professional polish throughout
- No broken links or placeholder content

### Technical Requirements
- Built in Framer (not imported)
- Clean component structure
- Optimized images (WebP preferred)
- Smooth animations (60fps)
- SEO metadata configured

### Required Assets
- **Template Name**: Clear, descriptive
- **Short Description**: Punchy value proposition (1-2 sentences)

- **Screenshots**: 
  - Cover image (1920x1080)
  - 5-10 preview images

- **Preview Link**: Live demo on Framer
- **Category**: SaaS, Portfolio, Agency, etc.

## Key Success Factors

files.name: GLM-5-RESEARCH.md
files.content:
# GLM-5 Research â€” Adding to Our LLM Stack
*Date: 2026-02-13 | Released: Feb 11, 2026 (2 days ago!)*

---

## ðŸ”¥ What is GLM-5?

**GLM-5** is Zhipu AI's (Z.ai) new flagship open-source LLM.

| Spec | Value |
|------|-------|
| **Parameters** | 744B total (40B active â€” MoE architecture) |
| **Context** | 128K tokens |
| **License** | MIT (fully open-source, commercial use!) |
| **Released** | February 11, 2026 |
| **Beats** | GPT-5.2 on BrowseComp, Vending Bench 2 & Terminal-Bench |
| **Competes with** | Claude Opus 4.5, GPT-5.2, Gemini 3.0 Pro |
| **Specialty** | Complex systems engineering, long-horizon agentic tasks |

---

## ðŸ’° Pricing (Z.ai Direct API)

| Model | Input (per 1M tokens) | Output (per 1M tokens) | Notes |
|-------|----------------------|------------------------|-------|
| **GLM-5** | $1.00 | $3.20 | Flagship |
| **GLM-5-Code** | $1.20 | $5.00 | Coding specialist |
| **GLM-4.7** | $0.60 | $2.20 | Previous gen |
| **GLM-4.7-Flash** | **FREE** | **FREE** | Fast, free forever |
| **GLM-4.5-Flash** | **FREE** | **FREE** | Free forever |
| **GLM-4.5-Air** | $0.20 | $1.10 | Lightweight |

**Cached input is limited-time FREE for all paid models!**

---

## ðŸ†“ FREE Access Options

### 1. Z.ai Direct (Free Trial Credits)
- **URL:** https://z.ai
- **API:** https://api.z.ai/api/paas/v4/chat/completions
- **Free credits for new users** on signup
- **GLM-4.7-Flash & GLM-4.5-Flash = permanently FREE**
- Coding plan from $10/mo (supports Claude Code, OpenClaw)

### 2. OpenRouter
- **URL:** https://openrouter.ai/z-ai/glm-5
- Already on OpenRouter â€” we have an OpenRouter account!
- Can add to our fallback chain immediately

### 3. Puter.js (Unlimited, No API Key)
- **URL:** https://developer.puter.com/tutorials/free-unlimited-zai-glm-api/
- Free unlimited access via Puter.js SDK
- "User-Pays" model â€” each user covers costs
- Works for web apps

### 4. Ollama (Self-hosted, FREE)
- Download weights from HuggingFace: https://huggingface.co/zai-org/GLM-5
- Run locally with Ollama
- Completely free, no API limits
- Requires significant GPU (744B model)

### 5. Modal (Free Trial)
- **URL:** https://modal.com/blog/try-glm-5
- Free trial available

---

## ðŸ”§ How to Add GLM-5 to OpenClaw

### Option A: Via OpenRouter (Easiest)
We already have OpenRouter configured. GLM-5 is available at:
- Model ID: `z-ai/glm-5`
- Provider: `openrouter`
- Full path: `openrouter/z-ai/glm-5`

**To add:** Update OpenClaw config to include `openrouter/z-ai/glm-5` as a fallback model.

### Option B: Z.ai Direct API
1. Sign up at https://z.ai
2. Get API key
3. Add to OpenClaw config as custom provider:
   - Base URL: `https://api.z.ai/api/paas/v4`
   - OpenAI-compatible API format
   - Model: `glm-5`

### Option C: Free Flash Models
For cost optimization, add the FREE models:
- `openrouter/z-ai/glm-4.7-flash` (FREE!)
- `openrouter/z-ai/glm-4.5-flash` (FREE!)

---

## ðŸ“Š Comparison with Our Current Models

| Model | Input Cost | Output Cost | Quality | Speed |
|-------|-----------|-------------|---------|-------|
| Claude Opus 4.6 | $15.00 | $75.00 | â­â­â­â­â­ | Slow |
| **GLM-5** | **$1.00** | **$3.20** | â­â­â­â­ | Medium |
| Groq Llama 3.3 | Free | Free | â­â­â­ | Ultra-fast |
| **GLM-4.7-Flash** | **FREE** | **FREE** | â­â­â­â­ | Fast |
| NVIDIA Kimi K2.5 | Free credits | Free credits | â­â­â­â­ | Medium |

**GLM-5 is 15x cheaper than Claude Opus for input, 23x cheaper for output!**

---

## ðŸŽ¯ Recommendation

1. **Immediately add GLM-4.7-Flash (FREE)** to our fallback chain via OpenRouter
2. **Add GLM-5** via OpenRouter for high-quality tasks at 15x lower cost
3. **Sign up at Z.ai** for direct API access + free trial credits
4. **Updated fallback chain:** Opus â†’ GLM-5 â†’ Groq â†’ GLM-4.7-Flash â†’ NVIDIA â†’ OpenRouter

---

*This model could save us significant costs while maintaining quality for coding and agentic tasks.*

files.name: LLM-COST-OPTIMIZATION.md
files.content:
# LLM Cost Optimization Guide

*Goal: Maximize AI usage while minimizing costs*

---

## ðŸ†“ FREE Options

### 1. OpenRouter Free Models
**URL:** https://openrouter.ai/collections/free-models

Available free models include:
- **Llama 3.3 70B** â€” Meta's best open model, 128K context
- **GPT-OSS 120B** â€” OpenAI's open-weight MoE model
- **Mistral models** â€” Various free tiers
- **Qwen models** â€” Some free variants

**Setup:** Create account at openrouter.ai, get API key, no credit card needed for free tier.

---

### 2. Groq (Extremely Fast + Free Tier)
**URL:** https://console.groq.com

- **Llama 3.3 70B Versatile** â€” 128K context, tool use, JSON mode
- **Speed:** 100+ tokens/second (fastest inference available)
- **Free tier:** Yes, with rate limits
- **Paid:** Very cheap when you exceed free tier

**Why use:** Best for quick tasks that need speed over deep reasoning.

---

### 3. GitHub Copilot ($10/month = Unlimited Claude Access!)
**URL:** https://github.com/features/copilot

For $10/month you get:
- Unlimited GPT-5-mini access
- **300 requests/month to Claude Sonnet 4.5**
- Access to premium models
- Can bring your own API key too

**Bonus:** There's a reverse proxy project that exposes Copilot as OpenAI/Anthropic compatible API:
https://github.com/ericc-ch/copilot-api

---

### 4. NVIDIA API Catalog
**URL:** https://build.nvidia.com

- Free trial with **1,000-5,000 credits**
- Various LLMs, vision, speech models
- Good for experimentation

---

### 5. Cloudflare Workers AI
- **10,000 neurons/day FREE**
- Edge deployment
- Fast, lightweight

---

## ðŸ’° CHEAP Options (Best Value)

### 1. Kimi K2 (Moonshot AI) â€” BEST VALUE
**URL:** https://platform.moonshot.ai

**Pricing:**
- Input: $0.60/million tokens
- Output: $2.50/million tokens
- Cache hits: $0.15/million tokens

**Specs:**
- 1 trillion parameters (32B activated)
- 256K context
- State-of-the-art for coding & reasoning
- OpenAI/Anthropic compatible API

**Even cheaper via DeepInfra:**
- $0.55/$2.20 per million tokens (in/out)

---

### 2. DeepInfra
**URL:** https://deepinfra.com

- Hosts Kimi K2, DeepSeek R1/V3, Llama, etc.
- Pay-per-use, no contracts
- Often cheapest for open-source models

---

### 3. Qwen 3 (Alibaba)
**URL:** https://qwen.ai/apiplatform

- Alibaba's flagship model
- Competitive pricing
- Strong multilingual support
- Available via multiple providers

---

## ðŸ”§ OpenClaw Fallback Setup

Configure OpenClaw to use cheap models for routine tasks, Opus for complex ones:

```json
{
  "agents": {
    "defaults": {
      "model": {
        "primary": "anthropic/claude-opus-4-5",
        "fallbacks": [
          "openrouter/meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct",
          "groq/llama-3.3-70b-versatile"
        ]
      }
    }
  },
  "models": {
    "providers": {
      "openrouter": {
        "baseUrl": "https://openrouter.ai/api/v1",
        "apiKey": "YOUR_OPENROUTER_KEY",
        "models": [
          {"id": "meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct", "name": "Llama 3.3 70B"}
        ]
      },
      "groq": {
        "baseUrl": "https://api.groq.com/openai/v1",
        "apiKey": "YOUR_GROQ_KEY",
        "models": [
          {"id": "llama-3.3-70b-versatile", "name": "Llama 3.3 70B Groq"}
        ]
      }
    }
  }
}
```

---

## ðŸ“Š Cost Comparison (per 1M tokens)

| Provider | Model | Input | Output |
|----------|-------|-------|--------|
| Anthropic | Claude Opus 4.5 | $15 | $75 |
| Anthropic | Claude Sonnet 4.5 | $3 | $15 |
| OpenAI | GPT-4 | $10 | $30 |
| Moonshot | Kimi K2 | $0.60 | $2.50 |
| DeepInfra | Kimi K2 | $0.55 | $2.20 |
| Groq | Llama 3.3 70B | ~$0.60 | ~$0.80 |
| OpenRouter | Llama 3.3 70B | FREE | FREE |

**Opus is ~30x more expensive than Kimi K2!**

---

## ðŸŽ¯ Recommended Strategy

1. **Complex reasoning/important tasks:** Claude Opus 4.5
2. **Coding/general tasks:** Kimi K2 or Sonnet 4.5
3. **Quick queries/drafts:** Groq Llama (fastest)
4. **Experimentation:** OpenRouter free models

---

## ðŸ”‘ API Keys to Get

1. **OpenRouter** (free): https://openrouter.ai/keys
2. **Groq** (free): https://console.groq.com
3. **Moonshot/Kimi** ($1 min): https://platform.moonshot.ai
4. **DeepInfra** (pay-per-use): https://deepinfra.com
5. **GitHub Copilot** ($10/mo): https://github.com/features/copilot

---

*Last Updated: 2026-02-01*

files.name: MODEL-ALLOCATION.md
files.content:
# Model Allocation Strategy

*Alex Prime's intelligent model routing for optimal cost/performance*

---

## ðŸŽ¯ Overview

Different tasks need different models. Here's my allocation strategy:

| Task Type | Primary Model | Fallback | Speed Model |
|-----------|--------------|----------|-------------|
| **Coding/Development** | Claude Opus 4.5 | Kimi K2.5 (NVIDIA) | Groq Llama 3.3 |
| **Research/Analysis** | Claude Opus 4.5 | OpenRouter Llama | Groq |
| **Social Media** | Claude Opus 4.5 | Groq Llama 3.3 | Groq |
| **Quick Chat** | Claude Opus 4.5 | Claude Haiku | Groq |
| **Image Generation** | Flux / DALL-E | - | - |
| **Voice/TTS** | ElevenLabs | OpenAI TTS | - |

---

## ðŸ’» Coding & Development

### Primary: Claude Opus 4.5
- **Why:** Best reasoning, code quality, debugging
- **Cost:** $5/$25 per MTok (input/output)
- **Use for:** Architecture decisions, complex code, refactoring

### Fallback: Kimi K2.5 (NVIDIA)
- **Why:** Free credits, good at code
- **Cost:** Free tier
- **Use for:** When Anthropic budget is tight

### Speed: Groq Llama 3.3 70B
- **Why:** Ultra-fast, free
- **Cost:** Free tier
- **Use for:** Quick code snippets, syntax questions

---

## ðŸ” Research & Analysis

### Primary: Claude Opus 4.5
- **Why:** Deep reasoning, nuanced analysis
- **Use for:** Complex research, strategic decisions

### Web Search: Brave API
- **Cost:** Free tier (2000 queries/month, 1/sec rate limit)
- **Use for:** Current information, fact-checking

### Summaries: Claude Sonnet 4.5
- **Cost:** $3/$15 per MTok
- **Use for:** Summarizing large documents (cheaper than Opus)

---

## ðŸ“± Social Media

### Content Creation: Claude Opus 4.5
- **Use for:** Thoughtful posts, strategy

### Quick Posts: Groq Llama 3.3
- **Use for:** Fast replies, simple updates

### Images: Flux / DALL-E 3
- **Use for:** Visual content generation

---

## ðŸ’¬ Chat & Communication

### Primary: Claude Opus 4.5 (via OpenClaw)
- Main session handler
- WhatsApp/Telegram/Discord

### Quick Reply Mode: Claude Haiku 4.5
- **Cost:** $1/$5 per MTok (5x cheaper than Opus)
- **Use for:** Simple acknowledgments, quick responses

### Voice: ElevenLabs (if configured)
- **Use for:** Audio messages, storytime

---

## ðŸ’° Cost Optimization Rules

1. **Opus for thinking** - Complex tasks, reasoning, coding
2. **Haiku for speed** - Quick responses, simple tasks
3. **Free tiers first** - Groq/NVIDIA for non-critical work
4. **Batch when possible** - 50% off with Anthropic batch API
5. **Cache prompts** - System prompts are cached automatically

---

## ðŸ“Š Anthropic Plans Comparison

### Current: API Pay-per-token ($20 credit)
| Model | Input | Output |
|-------|-------|--------|
| Opus 4.5 | $5/MTok | $25/MTok |
| Sonnet 4.5 | $3/MTok | $15/MTok |
| Haiku 4.5 | $1/MTok | $5/MTok |

### Claude Max Plan (NOT API)
- **$100/month:** 5x Pro usage limits (web/app only)
- **$200/month:** 20x Pro usage limits
- âš ï¸ This is for claude.ai web, NOT API access
- âš ï¸ No "unlimited API" plan exists

### Recommendation for Kabundji
1. Keep current $20/month API approach
2. Use free tier providers (Groq, NVIDIA) for backup
3. Consider Max only if doing heavy claude.ai web usage
4. For true unlimited: Enterprise negotiation needed

---

## ðŸ”„ Fallback Chain

```
Primary: Anthropic Claude Opus 4.5
    â†“ (if rate limited or error)
Fallback 1: Groq Llama 3.3 70B (free, ultra-fast)
    â†“ (if unavailable)
Fallback 2: NVIDIA Kimi K2.5 (free credits)
    â†“ (if unavailable)  
Fallback 3: OpenRouter Llama/Qwen (free tier)
    â†“ (if unavailable)
Fallback 4: Moonshot Kimi K2 (cheap backup)
```

---

## ðŸŽ›ï¸ OpenClaw Model Override

You can override my model per-session:
```
/status â†’ See current model
session_status(model="sonnet") â†’ Switch to Sonnet
session_status(model="default") â†’ Reset to Opus
```

---

---

## ðŸ“… Update: February 3, 2026 - Cost Optimization Implemented

### Changes Applied

| Setting | Before | After | Savings |
|---------|--------|-------|---------|
| **Heartbeat Model** | Opus 4.5 | Haiku 4 | ~80% cheaper |
| **Heartbeat Interval** | 10s | 1 hour | 360x fewer calls |
| **Subagent Model** | Opus 4.5 | Kimi K2.5 (free) | ~$100+/month |

### Model Aliases Now Available

- `/status model=opus` â†’ Claude Opus 4.5
- `/status model=sonnet` â†’ Claude Sonnet 4.5
- `/status model=haiku` â†’ Claude Haiku 4
- `/status model=kimi` â†’ Kimi K2.5 (NVIDIA)
- `/status model=groq` â†’ Llama 3.3 70B (Groq)

### Sonnet 5 "Fennec" - Coming Soon?

Leaked info suggests Claude Sonnet 5 may launch today (Feb 3). If confirmed:
- 50% cheaper than Opus 4.5
- May match or exceed Opus performance
- Will add as primary when available

See: `docs/SONNET5-RESEARCH.md` for full analysis.

---
